name: achievements
description: This library is used internally by Garry's Mod to help keep track of achievement progress and unlock the appropriate achievements once a certain number is reached.

functions.name: BalloonPopped
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of balloons burst. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Popper' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: Count
functions.description: Returns the amount of achievements in Garry's Mod.

functions.name: EatBall
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200, the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: GetCount
functions.description: Retrieves progress of given achievement

arguments.name: achievementID
arguments.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

functions.name: GetDesc
functions.description: Retrieves description of given achievement

arguments.name: achievementID
arguments.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve description of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

functions.name: GetGoal
functions.description: Retrieves progress goal of given achievement

arguments.name: achievementID
arguments.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve goal of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Retrieves name of given achievement

arguments.name: achievementID
arguments.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve name of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

functions.name: IncBaddies
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of baddies killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'War Zone' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: IncBystander
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of innocent animals killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Innocent Bystander' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: IncGoodies
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of friendly NPCs killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Bad Friend' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: IsAchieved
functions.description: Used in GMod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have unlocked certain achievements.

arguments.name: AchievementID
arguments.description: Internal Achievement ID number

returnValues.description: Returns true if the given achievementID is achieved.

functions.name: Remover
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of things removed. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Destroyer' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: SpawnedNPC
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of NPCs spawned. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Procreator' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: SpawnedProp
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of props spawned. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Creator' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: SpawnedRagdoll
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of ragdolls spawned. Once this count reaches 2000, the 'Dollhouse' achievement is unlocked.

functions.name: SpawnMenuOpen
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds one to the count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened. Once this count reaches 100,000, the 'Menu User' achievement is unlocked.

name: ai
description: The ai library.

functions.name: GetScheduleID
functions.description: Translates a schedule name to its corresponding ID.

arguments.name: sched
arguments.description: Then schedule name. In most cases, this will be the same as the <page>Enums/SCHED</page> name.

returnValues.description: The schedule ID, see <page>Enums/SCHED</page>. Returns -1 if the schedule name isn't valid.

functions.name: GetSquadLeader
functions.description: Returns the squad leader of the given squad.

arguments.name: squad
arguments.description: The squad name.

functions.name: GetSquadMemberCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of members a given squad has. See also <page>ai.GetSquadMembers</page>.

arguments.name: squad
arguments.description: The squad name.

functions.name: GetSquadMembers
functions.description: Returns all members of a given squad. See also <page>ai.GetSquadMemberCount</page> and <page>NPC:GetSquad</page>.

arguments.name: squad
arguments.description: The squad name.

returnValues.description: A table of <page>NPC</page>s in the given squad.

functions.name: GetTaskID
functions.description: Translates a task name to its corresponding ID.

arguments.name: task
arguments.description: The task name.

returnValues.description: The task ID, see [ai_task.h](https://github.com/ValveSoftware/source-sdk-2013/blob/55ed12f8d1eb6887d348be03aee5573d44177ffb/mp/src/game/server/ai_task.h#L89-L502). Returns -1 if the schedule name isn't valid.

name: ai_schedule
description: Allows you to set up a schedule for NPCs to follow. This lets you dictate their actions.

functions.name: New
functions.description: Creates a schedule for scripted NPC.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the schedule.

returnValues.description: A table containing schedule information to be used with <page>ENTITY:StartSchedule</page>.

name: ai_task
description: Used to create tasks for scripted NPCs.

functions.name: New
functions.description: Create a new empty task. Used by <page>Schedule:AddTask</page> and <page>Schedule:EngTask</page>.

name: baseclass
description: The baseclass library. Used to lookup a field from a metatable.

functions.name: Get
functions.description:
Gets the base class of an an object.

This is used not just by entities, but also by widgets, panels, drive modes, weapons and gamemodes (with "gamemode_" prefix).

The keyword **DEFINE_BASECLASS** translates into a call to this function. In the engine, it is replaced with:

```lua
local BaseClass = baseclass.Get
```

<note>You should prefer using this instead of `self.BaseClass` to avoid infinite recursion.</note>

For more information, including usage examples, see the <page>BaseClasses</page> reference page.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The child class.

functions.name: Set
functions.description:
Add a new base class that can be derived by others. This is done automatically for:
* [panels](vgui.Register)
* [drive modes](drive.Register)
* [entities and widgets](scripted_ents.Register)
* [weapons](weapons.Register)
* [gamemodes](gamemode.Register) (with prefix "gamemode_")

For more information, including usage examples, see the <page>BaseClasses</page> reference page.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of this base class. Must be completely unique.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: The base class.

name: bit
description:
The bitwise library contains useful functions for bitwise operations.
Make sure you're familiar with [Bitwise Operators](https://code.tutsplus.com/articles/understanding-bitwise-operators--active-11301)

functions.name: arshift
functions.description: Returns the arithmetically shifted value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: shiftCount
arguments.description: Amounts of bits to shift.

functions.name: band
functions.description: Performs the bitwise `and` for all values specified.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.
Values bit to perform bitwise "and" with. Optional.

functions.name: bnot
functions.description: Returns the bitwise not of the value. Inverts every bit of the 32bit integer.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be inverted.

returnValues.description: The result of bitwise not. 0101 becomes 1010, etc.

functions.name: bor
functions.description: Returns the bitwise OR of all values specified.

arguments.name: value1
arguments.description: The first value.
Extra values to be evaluated. (must all be numbers)

returnValues.description: The bitwise OR result between all numbers.

functions.name: bswap
functions.description: Swaps the byte order.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be byte swapped.

functions.name: bxor
functions.description: Returns the bitwise xor of all values specified.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: otherValues
arguments.description: Values bit xor with. Optional.

functions.name: lshift
functions.description:
Returns the left shifted value.
<note>The returned value will be clamped to a signed 32-bit integer, even on 64-bit builds.</note>

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: shiftCount
arguments.description: Amounts of bits to shift left by.

functions.name: rol
functions.description: Returns the left rotated value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: shiftCount
arguments.description: Amounts of bits to rotate left by.

functions.name: ror
functions.description: Returns the right rotated value.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: shiftCount
arguments.description: Amounts of bits to rotate right by.

functions.name: rshift
functions.description:
Returns the right shifted value.
<note>The returned value will be clamped to a signed 32-bit integer, even on 64-bit builds.</note>

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be manipulated.

arguments.name: shiftCount
arguments.description: Amounts of bits to shift right by.

functions.name: tobit
functions.description: Normalizes the specified value and clamps it in the range of a signed 32bit integer.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be normalized.

returnValues.description: The 32 bits of the provided value.

functions.name: tohex
functions.description: Returns the hexadecimal representation of the number with the specified number of characters.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be normalized.

arguments.name: characters
arguments.description: Maximum number of characters, if set. The absolute maximum is 8.

name: cam
description:
This directs all drawing to be done to a certain 2D or 3D plane or position, until the corresponding "End" function is called.

The matrix functions exist, but are mostly unusable unless you're familiar with the source engine's layout for each aspect.

functions.name: ApplyShake
functions.description: Shakes the screen at a certain position.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Origin of the shake.

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: Angles of the shake.

arguments.name: factor
arguments.description: The shake factor.

functions.name: End
functions.description:
Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

This function is an alias of <page>cam.End3D</page>.

functions.name: End2D
functions.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D context.

functions.name: End3D
functions.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

functions.name: End3D2D
functions.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D2D context.

functions.name: EndOrthoView
functions.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D orthographic rendering context.

functions.name: GetModelMatrix
functions.description:
Returns a copy of the model matrix that is at the top of the stack.
<note>Editing the matrix **will not** edit the current view. To do so, you will have to use <page>cam.PushModelMatrix</page>.</note>

functions.name: IgnoreZ
functions.description:
Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.

This is identical to calling `render.DepthRange( 0, 0.01 )` for `true` and  `render.DepthRange( 0, 1 )` for `false`. See <page>render.DepthRange</page>.

arguments.name: ignoreZ
arguments.description: Determines whenever to ignore the depth buffer or not.

functions.name: PopModelMatrix
functions.description: Pops the current active rendering matrix from the stack and reinstates the previous one.

functions.name: PushModelMatrix
functions.description:
Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack. Unlike opengl, this will replace the current model matrix.

<note>This does not work with <page>cam.Start3D2D</page> if `multiply` is false.</note>
<warning>When used in the Paint function of a panel, if you want to rely on the top-left position of the panel, you must use <page>VMatrix:Translate</page> with the (0, 0) position of the panel relative to the screen.</warning>

arguments.name: matrix
arguments.description: The matrix to push.

arguments.name: multiply
arguments.description: If set, multiplies given matrix with currently active matrix (<page>cam.GetModelMatrix</page>) before pushing.

functions.name: Start
functions.description:
Sets up a new rendering context. This is an extended version of <page>cam.Start3D</page> and <page>cam.Start2D</page>. Must be finished by <page>cam.End3D</page> or <page>cam.End2D</page>.

<bug issue="2682">This will not update current view properties for 3D contexts.</bug>

arguments.name: dataTbl
arguments.description: Render context config. See <page>Structures/RenderCamData</page>

functions.name: Start2D
functions.description:
Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by <page>cam.End2D</page>.

This is almost always used with a render target from the <page>render</page>. To set its position use <page>render.SetViewPort</page> with a target already stored.

<note>This will put an identity matrix at the top of the model matrix stack. If you are trying to use <page>cam.PushModelMatrix</page>, call it after this function and not before.</note>
<rendercontext hook="true" type="2D"></rendercontext>

functions.name: Start3D
functions.description:
Sets up a new 3D rendering context. Must be finished by <page>cam.End3D</page>.

For more advanced settings such as an orthographic view, use <page>cam.Start</page> instead, which this is an alias of basically.

<rendercontext hook="true" type="3D"></rendercontext>

<bug issue="1995">Negative x/y values won't work.</bug>

<bug issue="2682">This will not update current view properties.</bug>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Render cam position.

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: Render cam angles.

arguments.name: fov
arguments.description: Field of view.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X coordinate of where to start the new view port.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y coordinate of where to start the new view port.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the new viewport.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the new viewport.

arguments.name: zNear
arguments.description:
Distance to near clipping plane.
<note>Both `zNear` and `zFar` need a value before any of them work.

zNear also requires a value higher than 0.
</note>

arguments.name: zFar
arguments.description: Distance to far clipping plane.

functions.name: Start3D2D
functions.description:
Sets up the model transformation matrix to draw 2D content in 3D space and pushes it into the stack (<page>cam.PushModelMatrix</page>).

Matrix formula:
```
local m = Matrix()
m:SetAngles(angles)
m:SetTranslation(pos)
m:SetScale(Vector(scale, -scale, 1))
```
<warning>This must be closed by <page>cam.End3D2D</page>. If not done so, unexpected issues might arise.</warning>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Origin of the 3D2D context, ie. the top left corner, (0, 0).

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description:
Angles of the 3D2D context.
+x in the 2d context corresponds to +x of the angle (its forward direction).
+y in the 2d context corresponds to -y of the angle (its right direction).

If (dx, dy) are your desired (+x, +y) unit vectors, the angle you want is dx:AngleEx(dx:Cross(-dy)).

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description:
The scale of the render context.
If scale is 1 then 1 pixel in 2D context will equal to 1 unit in 3D context.

functions.name: StartOrthoView
functions.description: Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.

arguments.name: leftOffset
arguments.description: The left plane offset.

arguments.name: topOffset
arguments.description: The top plane offset.

arguments.name: rightOffset
arguments.description: The right plane offset.

arguments.name: bottomOffset
arguments.description: The bottom plane offset.

name: chat
description: The chat library's purpose is to interface with the default chatbox.

functions.name: AddText
functions.description: Adds text to the local player's chat box (which only they can read).

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description:
The arguments. Arguments can be:
* <page>table</page> - <page>Color</page>. Will set the color for all following strings until the next Color argument.
* <page>string</page> - Text to be added to the chat box.
* <page>Player</page> - Adds the name of the player in the player's team color to the chat box.
* <page>any</page> - Any other type, such as <page>Entity</page> will be converted to string and added as text.

functions.name: Close
functions.description: Closes the chat window.

functions.name: GetChatBoxPos
functions.description: Returns the chatbox position.

returnValues.description: The X coordinate of the chatbox's position.
The Y coordinate of the chatbox's position.

functions.name: GetChatBoxSize
functions.description: Returns the chatbox size.

functions.name: Open
functions.description: Opens the chat window.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: If equals 1, opens public chat, otherwise opens team chat

functions.name: PlaySound
functions.description: Plays the chat "tick" sound.

name: cleanup
description: The cleanup library allows you to control what happens to custom entities when the clean-up buttons are pressed in the Utilities tab of the Spawn menu (default Q).

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Adds an entity to a player's cleanup list.

arguments.name: pl
arguments.description: Who's cleanup list to add the entity to.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The type of cleanup.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to add to the player's cleanup list.

functions.name: CC_AdminCleanup
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by the `gmod_admin_cleanup` console command. Allows admins to clean up the server.

arguments.name: pl
arguments.description: The player that called the console command.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: The console command that called this function.

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: First and only arg is the cleanup type.

functions.name: CC_Cleanup
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by the `gmod_cleanup` console command. Allows players to cleanup their own props.

arguments.name: pl
arguments.description: The player that called the console command.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: The console command that called this function.

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: First and only argument is the cleanup type.

functions.name: GetList
functions.description: Gets the cleanup list.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Gets the table of cleanup types.

functions.name: Register
functions.description: Registers a new cleanup type.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Name of type.

functions.name: ReplaceEntity
functions.description:
Replaces one entity in the cleanup module with another.

You very likely want to call <page>undo.ReplaceEntity</page> with the same entities as well.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: Old entity

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: New entity. Can be a `NULL` entity to remove the old entity from the cleanup system.

functions.name: UpdateUI
functions.description: Repopulates the clients cleanup menu

name: concommand
description: The concommand library is used to create console commands which can be used to network (basic) information & events between the client and the server.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Creates a console command that runs a function in lua with optional autocompletion function and help text.

<bug issue="1183">This will fail if the concommand was previously removed with <page>concommand.Remove</page> in a different realm (creating a command on the client that was removed from the server and vice-versa).</bug>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The command name to be used in console.

This cannot be a name of existing console command or console variable. It will silently fail if it is.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to run when the concommand is executed.
<callback>
<arg name="ply" type="Player">The player that ran the concommand. NULL entity if command was entered with the dedicated server console.</arg>
<arg name="cmd" type="string">The concommand string (if one callback is used for several concommands).</arg>
<arg name="args" type="table">A table of all string arguments.</arg>
<arg name="argStr" type="string">The arguments as a string.</arg>
</callback>

arguments.name: autoComplete
arguments.description:
The function to call which should return a table of options for autocompletion. (<page text="Autocompletion Tutorial">Console_Command_Auto-completion</page>)

This only properly works on the client since it is **not** networked.

<callback>
<arg name="cmd" type="string">The concommand this autocompletion is for.</arg>
<arg name="argStr" type="string">The arguments typed so far.</arg>
<arg name="args" type="table">A table of all string arguments.</arg>
<ret name="tbl" type="table">A table containing the autocomplete options to display.</ret>
</callback>

arguments.name: helpText
arguments.description: The text to display should a user run 'help cmdName'.

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description: Console command modifier flags. Either a bitflag, or a table of enums. See <page>Enums/FCVAR</page>.

functions.name: AutoComplete
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by the engine to call the autocomplete function for a console command, and retrieve returned options.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: Name of command

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: Arguments given to the command

returnValues.description: Possibilities for auto-completion. This is the return value of the auto-complete callback.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns the tables of all console command callbacks, and autocomplete functions, that were added to the game with <page>concommand.Add</page>.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description:
Removes a console command.

<bug issue="1183"><page>concommand.Add</page> will fail if the concommand was previously removed with this function in a different realm (creating a command on the client that was removed from the server and vice-versa).</bug>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the command to be removed.

functions.name: Run
functions.description:
<internal>You might be looking for <page>Global.RunConsoleCommand</page> or <page>Player:ConCommand</page>.</internal>

Used by the engine to run a console command's callback function. This will only be called for commands that were added with <page>Global.AddConsoleCommand</page>, which <page>concommand.Add</page> calls internally. An error is sent to the player's console if no callback is found.

This will still be called for concommands removed with <page>concommand.Remove</page> but will return false. This will not be called for concommands added by the engine, only those made from Lua.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: Player to run concommand on

arguments.name: cmd
arguments.description: Command name

arguments.name: args
arguments.description:
Command arguments.
Can be table or string

arguments.name: argumentString
arguments.description: string of all arguments sent to the command

returnValues.description: `true` if the console command with the given name exists, and `false` if it doesn't.

name: constraint
description: The constraint library allows you to control the constraint system built into the physics engine (rope, weld, ballsockets, etc).

functions.name: AddConstraintTable
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Stores information about constraints in an entity's table.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: The entity to store the information on.

arguments.name: constrt
arguments.description: The constraint to store in the entity's table.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Optional. If different from `ent1`, the info will also be stored in the table for this entity.

arguments.name: ent3
arguments.description: Optional. Same as `ent2`.

arguments.name: ent4
arguments.description: Optional. Same as `ent2`.

functions.name: AddConstraintTableNoDelete
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Stores info about the constraints on the entity's table.

The only difference between this and <page>constraint.AddConstraintTable</page> is that the constraint does not get deleted when the entity is removed.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: The entity to store the information on.

arguments.name: constrt
arguments.description: The constraint to store in the entity's table.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Optional. If different from `ent1`, the info will also be stored in the table for this entity.

arguments.name: ent3
arguments.description: Optional. Same as `ent2`.

arguments.name: ent4
arguments.description: Optional. Same as `ent2`.

functions.name: AdvBallsocket
functions.description: Creates an advanced ballsocket (ragdoll) constraint. See <page>constraint.Ballsocket</page> for the simpler version.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description:
Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.
<warning>Does nothing!</warning>

arguments.name: forceLimit
arguments.description: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: torqueLimit
arguments.description: Amount of torque (rotation speed) until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: xMin
arguments.description: Minimum angle in rotations around the X axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: yMin
arguments.description: Minimum angle in rotations around the Y axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: zMin
arguments.description: Minimum angle in rotations around the Z axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: xMax
arguments.description: Maximum angle in rotations around the X axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: yMax
arguments.description: Maximum angle in rotations around the Y axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: zMax
arguments.description: Maximum angle in rotations around the Z axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: xFric
arguments.description: Rotational friction in the X axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: yFric
arguments.description: Rotational friction in the Y axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: zFric
arguments.description: Rotational friction in the Z axis local to the constraint.

arguments.name: onlyRotation
arguments.description: Only limit rotation, free movement.

arguments.name: noCollide
arguments.description: Whether the entities should be no-collided.

returnValues.description: A [phys_ragdollconstraint](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_ragdollconstraint) entity. Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Axis
functions.description: Creates an axis constraint.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: forceLimit
arguments.description: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: torqueLimit
arguments.description: Amount of torque (rotational force) until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: friction
arguments.description: Constraint friction.

arguments.name: noCollide
arguments.description: Whether the entities should be no-collided.

arguments.name: localAxis
arguments.description: If you include the LocalAxis then LPos2 will not be used in the final constraint. However, LPos2 is still a required argument.

arguments.name: dontAddTable
arguments.description: Whether or not to add the constraint info on the entity table. See <page>constraint.AddConstraintTable</page>.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_hinge](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_hinge)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Ballsocket
functions.description: Creates a ballsocket joint. See See <page>constraint.AdvBallsocket</page> if you also wish to limit rotation angles in some way.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos
arguments.description: Center position of the joint, relative to the **second** entity's physics object.

arguments.name: forcelimit
arguments.description: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: torquelimit

arguments.name: nocollide
arguments.description: Whether the constrained entities should collided with each other or not.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_ballsocket](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_ballsocket)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: CreateStaticAnchorPoint
functions.description:
Creates an invisible, non-moveable anchor point in the world to which things can be attached.
<note>The entity used internally by this function (`gmod_anchor`) only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes, meaning this function will only work in these gamemodes.

To use this in other gamemodes, you may need to create your own [gmod_anchor](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/entities/gmod_anchor.lua) entity.</note>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to spawn the anchor at

functions.name: Elastic
functions.description: Creates an elastic rope constraint.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls). Must be different from `bone1`.

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: constant
arguments.description: Stiffness of the elastic. The larger the number the less the elastic will stretch.

arguments.name: damping
arguments.description: How much energy the elastic loses. The larger the number, the less bouncy the elastic.

arguments.name: relDamping
arguments.description: The amount of energy the elastic loses proportional to the relative velocity of the two objects the elastic is attached to.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material of the rope. If unset, will be solid black.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Width of rope.

arguments.name: stretchOnly
arguments.description: Apply physics forces only on stretch.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the rope. See <page>Global.Color</page>.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_spring](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_spring)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.
The created rope. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Hydraulic
functions.description: Creates a controllable <page>constraint.Elastic</page>, aka a Hydraulic constraint.

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player that will be able to control the constraint. Used to call <page>numpad.OnDown</page>.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls). Must be different from `bone1`.

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: length1
arguments.description: Minimum length of the constraint.

arguments.name: length2
arguments.description: Maximum length of the constraint.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the rope.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key binding, corresponding to an <page>Enums/KEY</page>

arguments.name: slider
arguments.description: Whether the hydraulic is fixed, i.e. cannot bend. Must be `1` to act as `true`.

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: How fast it changes the length from `length1` to `length2` and backwards.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material of the rope. If unset, will be solid black.

arguments.name: toggle
arguments.description: Whether the hydraulic should be a toggle, not a "hold key to extend" action.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the rope. See <page>Global.Color</page>.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_spring](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_spring)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.
The created rope. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.
The muscle controller. (`gmod_winch_controller`) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.
The slider ([phys_slideconstraint](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_slideconstraint)) if `fixed` was exactly `1`. Will return nil otherwise, or if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Keepupright
functions.description: Creates a keep upright constraint.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to keep upright

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angle defined as "upright"

arguments.name: bone
arguments.description: The bone of the entity to constrain (0 for boneless)

arguments.name: angularLimit
arguments.description: Basically, the strength of the constraint. Must be above 0.

returnValues.description: The created constraint, if any or false if the constraint failed to set

functions.name: Motor
functions.description: Creates a motor constraint, a player controllable <page>constraint.Axis</page>.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls). Must be different from `bone1`.

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: friction
arguments.description: Motor friction.

arguments.name: torque
arguments.description: Motor torque.

arguments.name: forcetime
arguments.description: Automatic shut-off after this time has passed. A value of 0 means to stay on forever or until deactivated.

arguments.name: nocollide
arguments.description: Whether the entities should be no-collided.

arguments.name: toggle
arguments.description: Whether the constraint is on toggle.

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player that will control the motor. Used to to call <page>numpad.OnDown</page> and <page>numpad.OnUp</page>.

arguments.name: forcelimit
arguments.description: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: key_fwd
arguments.description: The key binding for "forward", corresponding to an <page>Enums/KEY</page>

arguments.name: key_bwd
arguments.description: The key binding for "backwards", corresponding to an <page>Enums/KEY</page>

arguments.name: direction
arguments.description: Either `1` or `-1` signifying which direction the motor should spin.

arguments.name: localAxis
arguments.description:
Overrides axis of rotation?
<validate></validate>

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_torque](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_torque)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.
The created axis constraint. ([phys_hinge](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_hinge)) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Muscle
functions.description:
Creates a muscle constraint.

Very similar to <page>constraint.Hydraulic</page>, but instead of a toggle between fully expanded and contracted, it will continuously alternate between the 2 states while enabled.

arguments.name: player
arguments.description: The player that will be able to control the constraint. Used to call <page>numpad.OnDown</page>.

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls). Must be different from `bone1`.

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos2
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: length1
arguments.description: Minimum length of the constraint.

arguments.name: length2
arguments.description: Maximum length of the constraint.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Width of the rope.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key binding, corresponding to an <page>Enums/KEY</page>.

arguments.name: fixed
arguments.description: Whether the constraint is fixed, i.e. cannot bend. Must be `1` to act as `true`.

arguments.name: period
arguments.description: How often the "contractions" should happen.

arguments.name: amplitude
arguments.description: Amplification of the "contractions"?

arguments.name: startOn
arguments.description: Whether the constraint should start activated. (i.e. spazzing)

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: Material of the rope. If left unset, will be solid black.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the rope. See <page>Global.Color</page>.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_spring](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_spring)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.
The created rope. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.
The muscle controller. (`gmod_winch_controller`) Will return `nil` if the constraint could not be created.
The slider ([phys_slideconstraint](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_slideconstraint)) if `fixed` was exactly `1`. Will return nil otherwise, or if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: NoCollide
functions.description:
Creates an no-collide "constraint". Disables collision between two entities.
<note>Does not work with players.</note>

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity.

arguments.name: ent2
arguments.description: Second entity.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone2
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: disableOnRemove
arguments.description: If set, the nocollide will be reversed if the constraint is removed.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([logic_collision_pair](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Logic_collision_pair)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.

functions.name: Pulley
functions.description:
Creates a pulley constraint.

It consists of 3 rope segments, 2 of which have variable length, visually connected by a 3rd. Reducing length of one end will increase the length of the other end.

You can visualize the pulley like so
```
WPos2 --- WPos3
|			|
|			|
Ent1	   Ent4
```

arguments.name: ent1
arguments.description: First entity to constrain.

arguments.name: ent4
arguments.description: The other entity to attach to.

arguments.name: bone1
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of first entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: bone4
arguments.description:
<page>PhysObj</page> number of second entity to constrain to. (0 for non-ragdolls).

See <page>Entity:TranslateBoneToPhysBone</page>.

arguments.name: localPos1
arguments.description: Position relative to the the first physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: localPos4
arguments.description: Position relative to the the second physics object to constrain to.

arguments.name: worldPos2
arguments.description: World position constrain the first entity to. This point will be static.

arguments.name: worldPos3
arguments.description: World position constrain the second entity to. This point will be static.

arguments.name: forceLimit
arguments.description: Amount of force until it breaks (0 = unbreakable)

arguments.name: rigid
arguments.description: Whether the constraint is rigid, i.e. cannot bend.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Width of the rope. If below or at `0`, visual rope segments will not be created.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: Material of the rope. If unset, will be solid black.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the rope. See <page>Global.Color</page>.

returnValues.description: The created constraint. ([phys_pulleyconstraint](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Phys_pulleyconstraint)) Will return `false` if the constraint could not be created.
The first rope segment. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint or this rope segment could not be created.
The second rope segment. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint or this rope segment could not be created.
The third rope segment. ([keyframe_rope](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Keyframe_rope)) Will return `nil` if the constraint or this rope segment could not be created.

name: construct
description: The construct library is used to control the physical properties of entities.

functions.name: Magnet
functions.description: Creates a magnet.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: Player that will have the numpad control over the magnet

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position of the magnet

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angles of the magnet

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The model of the maget

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: Material of the magnet ( texture )

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key to toggle the magnet, see <page>Enums/KEY</page>

arguments.name: maxObjects
arguments.description: Maximum amount of objects the magnet can hold

arguments.name: strength
arguments.description: Strength of the magnet

arguments.name: nopull
arguments.description: If > 0, disallows the magnet to pull objects towards it

arguments.name: allowrot
arguments.description: If > 0, allows rotation of the objects attached

arguments.name: startOn
arguments.description: If > 0, enabled from spawn

arguments.name: toggle
arguments.description: If != 0, pressing the key toggles the magnet, otherwise you'll have to hold the key to keep it enabled

arguments.name: vel
arguments.description: Velocity to set on spawn

arguments.name: aVel
arguments.description: Angular velocity to set on spawn

arguments.name: frozen
arguments.description: Freeze the magnet on start

functions.name: SetPhysProp
functions.description: Sets props physical properties.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player. This variable is not used and can be left out.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to apply properties to

arguments.name: physObjID
arguments.description: You can use this or the argument below. This will be used in case you don't provide argument below.

arguments.name: physObj
arguments.description: The physics object to apply the properties to

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The table containing properties to apply. See <page>Structures/PhysProperties</page>

name: controlpanel
description: The controlpanel library.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description: Clears ALL the control panels ( for tools )

functions.name: Get
functions.description: Returns (or creates if not exists) a control panel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the panel. For normal tools this will be equal to `TOOL.Mode` (the tool's filename without the extension).

When you create a tool/option via <page>spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption</page>, the internal control panel name is `TOOL.Mode .. "_" .. tool_tab:lower() .. "_" .. tool_category:lower()`.

name: cookie
description:
Functions to persist data on a user's computer.

The data will be read / written to / from a database
corresponding to the realm the library was used in.


| Realm | Database File |
|:-----:|:-----|
| [Server] | `garrysmod/sv.db`
| [Client] | `garrysmod/cl.db`
|  [Menu]  | `garrysmod/mn.db`

[Server]: /gmod/States#server
[Client]: /gmod/States#client
[Menu]: /gmod/States#menu

functions.name: Delete
functions.description:
Removes any cookie with the given name.

Does nothing if the cookie doesn't exist.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The name of the cookie that you want to delete.

functions.name: GetNumber
functions.description: Gets the value of a cookie on the client as a number.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the cookie that you want to get.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Value to return if the cookie does not exist.

functions.name: GetString
functions.description: Gets the value of a cookie on the client as a string.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the cookie that you want to get.

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: Value to return if the cookie does not exist.

functions.name: Set
functions.description: Creates / updates a cookie in the <page text="Database">cookie</page>.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The name of the cookie.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The data stored in the cookie.

name: coroutine
description: Coroutines are similar to threads, however they do not run simultaneously. They offer a way to split up tasks and dynamically pause & resume functions.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a coroutine of the given function.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function for the coroutine to use.

functions.name: isyieldable
functions.description:
Returns whether the running coroutine can yield.
A running coroutine is yieldable if it is not in the main thread, and it is not inside a non-yieldable C function.
<note>This is only available on the x86-64 versions, because of the difference in the LuaJIT version. [See here](jit.version)</note>

returnValues.name: canyield
returnValues.description: Returns true when the running coroutine can yield.

functions.name: resume
functions.description: Resumes the given coroutine and passes the given vararg to either the function arguments or the <page>coroutine.yield</page> that is inside that function and returns whatever yield is called with the next time or by the final return in the function.

arguments.name: coroutine
arguments.description: Coroutine to resume.

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: Arguments to be returned by <page>coroutine.yield</page>.

returnValues.description: If the executed thread code had no errors occur within it.
If an error occurred, this will be a string containing the error message. Otherwise, this will be arguments that were yielded.

functions.name: running
functions.description: Returns the active coroutine or nil if we are not within a coroutine.

functions.name: status
functions.description: Returns the status of the coroutine passed to it, the possible statuses are "suspended", "running", and "dead".

arguments.name: coroutine
arguments.description: Coroutine to check the status of.

functions.name: wait
functions.description:
Repeatedly yields the coroutine for the given duration before continuing.

Only works inside a coroutine. Only useful in nextbot coroutine think function.

This function uses <page>Global.CurTime</page> instead of <page>Global.RealTime</page>.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: The number of seconds to wait

functions.name: wrap
functions.description:
Returns a function which calling is equivalent with calling <page>coroutine.resume</page> with the coroutine and all extra parameters.

The values returned by the returned function only contain the values passed to the inner <page>coroutine.yield</page> call and do not include the *no error* status that <page>coroutine.resume</page> provides. In case of failure, an error is thrown instead.

arguments.name: coroutine
arguments.description: Coroutine to resume.

functions.name: yield
functions.description: Pauses the active coroutine and passes all additional variables to the call of <page>coroutine.resume</page> that resumed the coroutine last time, and returns all additional variables that were passed to the previous call of resume.

arguments.name: returnValue
arguments.description: Arguments to be returned by the last call of <page>coroutine.resume</page>.

returnValues.description: Arguments that were set previously by <page>coroutine.resume</page>.

name: cvars
description: The cvars library allows you to control what happens when a cvar (console variable) is changed.

functions.name: AddChangeCallback
functions.description:
Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.

<bug issue="1440">This does not callback convars in the menu state.</bug>
<bug issue="3503">This does not callback convars on the client with FCVAR_GAMEDLL and convars on the server without FCVAR_GAMEDLL.</bug>
<bug issue="3740">This does not callback convars on the client with FCVAR_REPLICATED.</bug>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the convar to add the change callback to.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called when the convar changes.
<callback>
<arg type="string" name="convar">The name of the convar.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="oldValue">The old value of the convar.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="newValue">The new value of the convar.</arg>
</callback>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description:
If set, you will be able to remove the callback using <page>cvars.RemoveChangeCallback</page>.

The identifier is not required to be globally unique, as it's paired with the actual name of the convar.

functions.name: Bool
functions.description: Retrieves console variable as a boolean.

arguments.name: cvar
arguments.description: Name of console variable

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The value to return if the console variable does not exist

functions.name: GetConVarCallbacks
functions.description: Returns a table of the given <page>ConVar</page>s callbacks.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the <page>ConVar</page>.

arguments.name: createIfNotFound
arguments.description:
Whether or not to create the internal callback table for given <page>ConVar</page> if there isn't one yet.


This argument is internal and should not be used.

returnValues.description: A table of the convar's callbacks, or nil if the convar doesn't exist.

functions.name: Number
functions.description: Retrieves console variable as a number.

arguments.name: cvar
arguments.description: Name of console variable

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The value to return if the console variable does not exist

returnValues.description: Retrieved value or the second argument if the console variable does not exist. Will return 0 if the console variable exists and has a string value.

functions.name: OnConVarChanged
functions.description:
<internal>You are probably looking for <page>cvars.AddChangeCallback</page>.</internal>

Called by the engine when a convar value changes.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Convar name

arguments.name: oldVal
arguments.description: The old value of the convar

arguments.name: newVal
arguments.description: The new value of the convar

functions.name: RemoveChangeCallback
functions.description: Removes a callback for a convar using the the callback's identifier. The identifier should be the third argument specified for <page>cvars.AddChangeCallback</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the convar to remove the callback from.

arguments.name: indentifier
arguments.description: The callback's identifier.

functions.name: String
functions.description: Retrieves console variable as a string.

arguments.name: cvar
arguments.description: Name of console variable

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The value to return if the console variable does not exist

name: debug
description: The debug library is intended to help you debug your scripts, however it also has several other powerful uses. Some builtin debug function were removed in GMod due to security reasons

functions.name: debug
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

<note> This only works on the source dedicated server. </note>

Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters. Using simple commands and other debug facilities, the user can inspect global and local variables, change their values, evaluate expressions, and so on. A line containing only the word cont finishes this function, so that the caller continues its execution.

* Commands for debug.debug are not lexically nested within any function, and so have no direct access to local variables.
* To exit this interactive mode, you can press Ctrl + Z then Enter OR type the word 'cont' on a single line and press enter.

functions.name: getfenv
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Returns the environment of the passed object. This can be set with <page>debug.setfenv</page>

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: Object to get environment of

functions.name: gethook
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Returns the current hook settings of the passed thread. The thread argument can be omitted. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html. This function will simply return the function, mask, and count of the last called <page>debug.sethook</page>.

arguments.name: thread
arguments.description: Which thread to retrieve it's hook from, doesn't seem to actually work.

returnValues.description: Hook mask. This is reversed of the <page>debug.sethook</page> mask ("clr" would be "rlc").

functions.name: getinfo
functions.description: Returns debug information about a function.

arguments.name: funcOrStackLevel
arguments.description:
Takes either a function or a number representing the stack level as an argument. Stack level 0 always corresponds to the debug.getinfo call, 1 would be the function calling debug.getinfo in most cases, and so on.

Returns useful information about that function in a table.

arguments.name: fields
arguments.description:
A string whose characters specify the information to be retrieved.

* `f` - Populates the func field.
* `l` - Populates the currentline field.
* `L` - Populates the activelines field.
* `n` - Populates the name and namewhat fields - only works if stack level is passed rather than function pointer.
* `S` - Populates the location fields (lastlinedefined, linedefined, short_src, source and what).
* `u` - Populates the argument and upvalue fields (isvararg, nparams, nups).
* `>` - Causes this function to use the last argument to get the data from

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: Function to use. (Only used by the `>` field)

returnValues.description: A table as a <page>Structures/DebugInfo</page> containing information about the function you passed. Can return nil if the stack level didn't point to a valid stack frame.

functions.name: getlocal
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Gets the name and value of a local variable indexed from the level.
<warning>When a function has a tailcall return, you cannot access the locals of this function.</warning>

arguments.name: thread
arguments.description: The thread

arguments.name: level
arguments.description:
The level above the thread.
* 0 = the function that was called (most always this function)'s arguments
* 1 = the thread that had called this function.
* 2 = the thread that had called the function that started the thread that called this function.

A function defined in Lua can also be passed as the level. The index will specify the parameter's name to be returned (a parameter will have a value of nil).

arguments.name: index
arguments.description:
The variable's index you want to get.
* 1 = the first local defined in the thread
* 2 = the second local defined in the thread
* etc...

returnValues.description:
The name of the variable.

Sometimes this will be `(*temporary)` if the local variable had no name.

<note>Variables with names starting with **(** are **internal variables**.</note>
The value of the local variable.

functions.name: getmetatable
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Returns the metatable of an object. This function ignores the metatable's __metatable field.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: The object to retrieve the metatable from.

returnValues.description: The metatable of the given object.

functions.name: getregistry
functions.description:
<deprecated>
This function **will** return an empty table.
If you get an error because of this see the example below for a workaround
</deprecated>

Returns the internal Lua registry table.

The Lua registry is used by the engine and binary modules to create references to Lua values. The registry contains every global ran and used in the Lua environment. Avoid creating entries into the registry with a number as the key, as they are reserved for the reference system.

<warning>Improper editing of the registry can result in unintended side effects, including crashing the game.</warning>

functions.name: getupvalue
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Used for getting variable values in an index from the passed function. This does nothing for C functions.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: Function to get the upvalue indexed from.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index in the upvalue array. The max number of entries can be found in <page>debug.getinfo</page>'s "<page text="nups">Structures/DebugInfo</page>" key.

returnValues.description: Name of the upvalue. Will be nil if the index was out of range (< 1 or > <page>debug.getinfo</page>.nups), or the function was defined in C.

functions.name: setfenv
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Sets the environment of the passed object.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: Object to set environment of

arguments.name: env
arguments.description: Environment to set

functions.name: sethook
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Sets the given function as a Lua hook. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. The thread argument can be completely omitted and calling this function with no arguments will remove the current hook. This is used by default for infinite loop detection. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html and https://www.gammon.com.au/scripts/doc.php?lua=debug.sethook

Hooks are not always ran when code that has been compiled by LuaJIT's JIT compiler is being executed, this is due to Intermediate Representation internally storing constantly running bytecode for performance reasons.

arguments.name: thread
arguments.description: Thread to set the hook on. This argument can be omited

arguments.name: hook
arguments.description: Function for the hook to call. First argument in this function will be the mask event that called the hook as a full string (not as 'c' but instead as 'call').

arguments.name: mask
arguments.description:
The hook's mask. Can be one or more of the following events:
* c - Triggers the hook on each function call made from Lua.
* r - Triggers the hook on each function return made from Lua.
* l - Triggers the hook on each line compiled of code.
* t - Triggers the hook on each function call made from Lua or C/C++.
* u - Triggers the hook on each function return made from Lua or C/C++.
* k - Triggers the hook on each function call or return made from Lua or C/C++.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: How often to call the hook (in instructions). 0 for every instruction. Can be omitted.

functions.name: setlocal
functions.description:
<removed>This function was removed due to security concerns.</removed>

Sets a local variable's value.

arguments.name: thread
arguments.description: The thread

arguments.name: level
arguments.description:
The level above the thread.
0 is the function that was called (most always this function)'s arguments

1 is the thread that had called this function.

2 is the thread that had called the function that started the thread that called this function.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description:
The variable's index you want to get.

1 = the first local defined in the thread

2 = the second local defined in the thread

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to set the local to

returnValues.description: The name of the local variable if the local at the index exists, otherwise nil is returned.

functions.name: setmetatable
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Sets the object's metatable. Unlike <page>Global.setmetatable</page>, this function works regardless of whether the first object passed is a valid table or not; this function even works on primitive datatypes such as numbers, functions, and even nil.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: Object to set the metatable for.

arguments.name: metatable
arguments.description:
The metatable to set for the object.
If this argument is nil, then the object's metatable is removed.

returnValues.description: true if the object's metatable was set successfully.

functions.name: setupvalue
functions.description:
<removed>This function was removed due to security concerns.</removed>

Sets the variable indexed from func

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to index the upvalue from

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index from func

arguments.name: val
arguments.description: The value to set the upvalue to.

returnValues.description: Returns nil if there is no upvalue with the given index, otherwise it returns the upvalue's name.

functions.name: Trace
functions.description: Prints out the lua function call stack to the console.

functions.name: traceback
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Returns a full execution stack trace.

arguments.name: thread
arguments.description: Thread (ie. error object from xpcall error handler) to build traceback for. If this argument is not set to a proper <page>thread</page> it will act as the next argument.

arguments.name: message
arguments.description: Appended at the beginning of the traceback.

arguments.name: level
arguments.description: Which level to start the traceback.

returnValues.description: A dump of the execution stack.

functions.name: upvalueid
functions.description:
<removed>This function was removed due to security concerns.</removed>

Returns an unique identifier for the upvalue indexed from func

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to index the upvalue from

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index from func

functions.name: upvaluejoin
functions.description:
<removed>This function was removed due to security concerns.</removed>

Make the n1-th upvalue of the Lua closure f1 refer to the n2-th upvalue of the Lua closure f2.

name: debugoverlay
description:
The debugoverlay library is mainly useful for 3D debugging, it can be used to draw shapes on the screen for debug purposes.

<note>These functions will not do anything unless the **developer** console variable is set to non 0.</note>

functions.name: Axis
functions.description:
Displays an axis indicator at the specified position.

<note>This function will silently fail if the `developer` <page>ConVar</page> is set to `0`.
It is not networked to clients, except for the <page text="listen server host">Player:IsListenServerHost</page>.
It will not work when the game is paused.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: Position origin

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: Angle of the axis

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Size of the axis

arguments.name: lifetime
arguments.description: Number of seconds to appear

arguments.name: ignoreZ
arguments.description: If true, will draw on top of everything; ignoring the Z buffer

functions.name: Box
functions.description:
Displays a solid coloured box at the specified position.

<note>This function will silently fail if the `developer` <page>ConVar</page> is set to `0`.
It is not networked to clients, except for the <page text="listen server host">Player:IsListenServerHost</page>.
It will not work when the game is paused.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: Position origin

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: Minimum bounds of the box

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: Maximum bounds of the box

arguments.name: lifetime
arguments.description: Number of seconds to appear

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the box. Uses the <page>Color</page>

functions.name: BoxAngles
functions.description:
Displays a solid colored rotated box at the specified position.

<note>This function will silently fail if the `developer` <page>ConVar</page> is set to `0`.
It is not networked to clients, except for the <page text="listen server host">Player:IsListenServerHost</page>.
It will not work when the game is paused.</note>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: World position

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The mins of the box (lowest corner)

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maxs of the box (highest corner)

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angle to draw the box at

arguments.name: lifetime
arguments.description: Amount of seconds to show the box

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the box. Uses the <page>Color</page>

functions.name: Cross
functions.description:
Creates a coloured cross at the specified position for the specified time.

<note>This function will silently fail if the `developer` <page>ConVar</page> is set to `0`.
It is not networked to clients, except for the <page text="listen server host">Player:IsListenServerHost</page>.

arguments.name: position

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the cross. Uses the <page>Color</page>

arguments.name: ignoreZ

functions.name: EntityTextAtPosition

arguments.name: color

Draws a 3D grid of limited size in given position.

It is not networked to clients, except for the <page text="listen server host">Player:IsListenServerHost</page>.

name: derma
description: The derma library allows you to add custom derma controls and create & modify derma skins.

functions.name: Color
functions.description: Gets the color from a Derma skin of a panel and returns default color if not found

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: The default color in case of failure.

functions.name: Controls
functions.description:
This is NOT a function, it's a variable containing all derma controls, registered with <page>derma.DefineControl</page>.

Use <page>derma.GetControlList</page> to retrieve this list.

It's a list of tables, each having 3 keys, all from <page>derma.DefineControl</page> arguments:
* <page>string</page> ClassName - The class name of the panel
* <page>string</page> Description - The description of the panel
* <page>string</page> BaseClass - The base class of the panel

returnValues.description: The list of all registered derma controls.

functions.name: DefineControl
functions.description:
Defines a new Derma control with an optional base.

This calls <page>vgui.Register</page> internally, but also does the following:
* Adds the control to <page>derma.GetControlList</page>
* Adds a key "Derma" - This is returned by <page>derma.GetControlList</page>
* Makes a global table with the name of the control (This is technically deprecated and should not be relied upon)
* If reloading (i.e. called this function with name of an existing panel), updates all existing instances of panels with this name. (Updates functions, calls <page>PANEL:PreAutoRefresh</page> and <page>PANEL:PostAutoRefresh</page>, etc.)

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the newly created control

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: Description of the control

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table containing control methods and properties

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Derma control to base the new control off of

returnValues.description: A table containing the new control's methods and properties

functions.name: DefineSkin
functions.description: Defines a new skin so that it is usable by Derma. The default skin can be found in `garrysmod/lua/skins/default.lua`

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the skin

arguments.name: descriptions
arguments.description: Description of the skin

arguments.name: skin
arguments.description: Table containing skin data

functions.name: GetControlList
functions.description: Returns the <page>derma.Controls</page> table, a list of all derma controls registered with <page>derma.DefineControl</page>.

returnValues.description: A listing of all available derma-based controls. See <page>derma.Controls</page> for structure and contents.

functions.name: GetDefaultSkin
functions.description: Returns the default skin table, which can be changed with the hook <page>GM:ForceDermaSkin</page>

functions.name: GetNamedSkin
functions.description: Returns the skin table of the skin with the supplied name

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of skin

functions.name: GetSkinTable
functions.description: Returns a copy of the table containing every Derma skin

functions.name: RefreshSkins
functions.description: Clears all cached panels so that they reassess which skin they should be using.

functions.name: SkinChangeIndex
functions.description: Returns how many times <page>derma.RefreshSkins</page> has been called.

returnValues.description: Amount of times <page>derma.RefreshSkins</page> has been called.

functions.name: SkinHook
functions.description: Calls the specified hook for the given panel

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The type of hook to run

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the hook to run

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: The panel to call the hook for

arguments.name: vararg1
arguments.description: First parameter for the panel hook. i.e. width of the panel for <page text="Paint">PANEL:Paint</page> hooks.

arguments.name: vararg2
arguments.description: Second parameter for the panel hook. i.e. height of the panel for <page text="Paint">PANEL:Paint</page> hooks.

arguments.name: vararg3
arguments.description: Third parameter for the panel hook.

arguments.name: vararg4
arguments.description: Fourth parameter for the panel hook.

returnValues.description: The returned variable from the skin hook

functions.name: SkinList
functions.description: This is NOT a function, it's a variable containing all registered via <page>derma.DefineSkin</page> derma skins.

returnValues.description: The list of all registered derma skins.

functions.name: SkinTexture
functions.description:
Returns a function to draw a specified texture of panels skin.

These are usually generated via <page>GWEN.CreateTextureBorder</page> and similar.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The identifier of the texture

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: Panel to get the skin of.

arguments.name: fallback
arguments.description: What to return if we failed to retrieve the texture

returnValues.description:
A function that is created with the <page>GWEN</page> library to draw a texture.

<callback>
<arg name="x" type="number">X coordinate for the box.</arg>
<arg name="y" type="number">Y coordinate for the box.</arg>
<arg name="w" type="number">Width of the box.</arg>
<arg name="h" type="number">Height of the box.</arg>
<arg name="clr" type="table" default="color_white">Optional color, default is white. Uses the <page>Color</page>.</arg>
</callback>

name: dragndrop
description: The drag'n'drop library, used internally by certain base panels to allow for drag'n'drop functionality, like spawnmenu's customizations.

functions.name: CallReceiverFunction
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Calls the receiver function of hovered panel.

arguments.name: bDoDrop
arguments.description: true if the mouse was released, false if we right clicked.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: The command value. This should be the ID of the clicked dropdown menu ( if right clicked, or nil )

arguments.name: mx
arguments.description: The local to the panel mouse cursor X position when the click happened.

arguments.name: my
arguments.description: The local to the panel  mouse cursor Y position when the click happened.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description: Clears all the internal drag'n'drop variables.

functions.name: Drop
functions.description: <internal></internal>Handles the drop action of drag'n'drop library.

functions.name: GetDroppable
functions.description: Returns a table of currently dragged panels.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: If set, the function will return only the panels with this <page>Panel:Droppable</page> name.

returnValues.description: A table of all panels that are being currently dragged, if any.

functions.name: HandleDroppedInGame
functions.description: Allows you to capture the panel that was dropped into the game (dropped onto the root panel). This function is meant to be overridden.

functions.name: HoverThink
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Handles the hover think. Called from <page>dragndrop.Think</page>.

functions.name: IsDragging
functions.description: Returns whether the user is dragging something with the drag'n'drop system.

returnValues.description: True if the user is dragging something with the drag'n'drop system.

functions.name: StartDragging
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Starts the drag'n'drop.

functions.name: StopDragging
functions.description: Stops the drag'n'drop and calls <page>dragndrop.Clear</page>.

functions.name: Think
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Handles all the drag'n'drop processes. Calls <page>dragndrop.UpdateReceiver</page> and <page>dragndrop.HoverThink</page>.

functions.name: UpdateReceiver
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Updates the receiver to drop the panels onto. Called from <page>dragndrop.Think</page>.

name: draw
description: The draw library's purpose is to simplify the usage of the <page>surface</page> library.

functions.name: DrawText
functions.description:
Simple draw text at position, but this will expand newlines and tabs.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

See also <page>MarkupObject</page> for limited width and markup support.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Text to be drawn.

arguments.name: font
arguments.description: Name of font to draw the text in. See <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own, or <page>Default Fonts</page> for a list of default fonts.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X Coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y Coordinate.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Color to draw the text in. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: xAlign
arguments.description: Where to align the text horizontally. Uses the <page>Enums/TEXT_ALIGN</page>.

functions.name: GetFontHeight
functions.description:
Returns the height of the specified font in pixels. This is equivalent to the height of the character `W`. See <page>surface.GetTextSize</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>
