name: sound
description: Used primarily for adding new soundscript entries.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Creates a sound script. It can also override sounds, which seems to only work when set on the server.

You can find a list of common sound scripts that are shipped with the game by default here: <page>Common Sounds</page>.

A list of sound scripts can be retrieved with <page>sound.GetTable</page>.

arguments.name: soundData
arguments.description: The sounds properties. See <page>Structures/SoundData</page>

functions.name: AddSoundOverrides
functions.description: Overrides sounds defined inside of a txt file; typically used for adding map-specific sounds.

arguments.name: filepath
arguments.description: Path to the script file to load.

functions.name: EmitHint
functions.description: Emits a sound hint to the game elements to react to, for example to repel or attract antlions.

arguments.name: hint
arguments.description: The hint to emit. This can be a bit flag. See <page>Enums/SOUND</page>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to emit the hint at

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: The volume or radius of the hint

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: The duration of the hint in seconds

arguments.name: owner
arguments.description: If set, the sound hint will be ignored/deleted when the given entity is destroyed.

functions.name: Generate
functions.description: Creates a sound from a function.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description:
A unique identifier for the sound.

<warning>You cannot override already existing ones.</warning>

arguments.name: samplerate
arguments.description: The sample rate of the sound. Must be `11025`, `22050` or `44100`.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The length in seconds of the sound to generate.

arguments.name: callbackOrData
arguments.description:
A function which will be called to generate every sample on the sound.

<callback>
<arg type="number" name="sampleIndex">The current sample number.</arg>
<ret type="number" name="sampleValue">The return value must be between `-1.0` and `1.0`.
Other values will wrap back to the -1 to 1 range and basically clip.
There are **65535** possible quantifiable values between `-1` and `1`.</ret>
</callback>

This argument can also be given a table of samples, where values must range from `-1` to `1`.
This argument can also be a string of raw 16bit binary data, (each sample is unsigned short).

arguments.name: loopStart
arguments.description: Sample ID of the loop start. If given, the sound will be looping and will restart playing at given position after reaching its end.

functions.name: GetLoudestSoundHint
functions.description: Returns the most dangerous/closest sound hint based on given location and types of sounds to sense.

arguments.name: types
arguments.description: The types of sounds to choose from. See <page text="SOUND_ enums">Enums/SOUND</page>.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to sense sounds at.

returnValues.description: A table with <page text="SoundHintData">Structures/SoundHintData</page> structure or `nil` if no sound hints are nearby.

functions.name: GetProperties
functions.description: Returns properties of the soundscript.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the sound script

returnValues.description: The properties of the soundscript. See <page>Structures/SoundData</page>

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description:
Returns a list of all registered sound scripts.

New ones can be registered using <page>sound.Add</page>, and detailed information about each one can be retrieved via <page>sound.GetProperties</page>.

returnValues.description: The list/array of all registered sound scripts ( No other information is provided )

functions.name: Play
functions.description:
Plays a sound from the specified position in the world.
If you want to play a sound without a position, such as a UI sound, use <page>surface.PlaySound</page> instead.

This function is similar to <page>Global.EmitSound</page>, but with less options.

arguments.name: snd
arguments.description: The sound to play. This should either be a sound script name (<page>sound.Add</page>) or a file path relative to the `sound/` folder. (Make note that it's not sound**s**)

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Where the sound should play.

arguments.name: level
arguments.description: Sound level in decibels. 75 is normal. Ranges from 20 to 180, where 180 is super loud. This affects how far away the sound will be heard, see <page>Enums/SNDLVL</page>.

arguments.name: pitch
arguments.description: The sound pitch. Range is from 0 to 255. 100 is normal pitch.

arguments.name: volume
arguments.description: Output volume of the sound in range 0 to 1.

arguments.name: dsp
arguments.description: The DSP preset for this sound. [List of DSP presets](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dsp_presets)

functions.name: PlayFile
functions.description:
Plays a file from GMod directory. You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For external file/stream playback, see <page>sound.PlayURL</page>.

<bug issue="1752">This fails for looping .wav files in 3D mode.</bug>

<bug issue="2304">This fails with unicode file names.</bug>

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path to the file to play.

Unlike other sound functions and structures, the path is relative to `garrysmod/` instead of `garrysmod/sound/`

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (" "):
* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position
* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel
* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called
* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for <page>IGModAudioChannel:SetTime</page>.

If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as "".

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded.

<callback>
<arg type="IGModAudioChannel" name="channel">The sound channel. Will be nil if an error occurred.</arg>
<arg type="number" name="errorID">ID of an error if an error has occurred. Will be nil, otherwise.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="errorName">Name of an error if an error has occurred. Will be nil, otherwise.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: PlayURL
functions.description:
Allows you to play external sound files, as well as online radio streams.
You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For offline file playback, see <page>sound.PlayFile</page>.

<bug issue="2296">Due to a bug with [BASS](http://www.un4seen.com/), AAC codec streams cannot be played in 3D mode.</bug>

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the sound to play

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (`" "`):
* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position
* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel
* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called
* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for <page>IGModAudioChannel:SetTime</page>.

If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as `""`.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded.
<callback>
<arg type="IGModAudioChannel" name="channel">The sound channel. Will be nil if an error occurred.</arg>
<arg type="number" name="errorID">ID of an error if an error has occurred. Will be nil, otherwise.</arg>
<arg type="string" name="errorName">Name of an error if an error has occurred. Will be nil, otherwise.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: SetActorGender
functions.description:
Sets the gender of a specific actor (model). This is a system from [base Half-Life 2](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Global_actors) - `global_actors.txt`.

This will affect what voice lines `npc_citizen` will use when they have the given model set.

It is not limited to `npc_citizens` - any sound played on any entity with given model can have gender specific sounds playing, including soundscripts, by including `$gender` token in the sound file path.

<warning>Internally the gender is stored by model file name only (i.e. `models/alyx.mdl` would be stored as `alyx`), not the full path! Be aware of potential collisions.</warning>

arguments.name: modelPath
arguments.description: Path to the model file to set the gender of.

arguments.name: gender
arguments.description: Gender to set. Only 2 options are permitted: `female` and `male`. Any other option will be ignored.

functions.description: Inserts a new tab into the CreationMenus table, which will be used by the creation menu to generate its tabs (Spawnlists, Weapons, Entities, etc.)

arguments.description:
The function called to generate the content of the tab.
<callback>
<ret type="Panel" name="content">A container panel that holds all of the content for the new tab.</ret>
</callback>

arguments.name: material

functions.name: AddPropCategory
functions.description:
Used to add addon spawnlists to the spawnmenu tree. This function should be called within <page>SANDBOX:PopulatePropMenu</page>.

Addon spawnlists will not save to disk if edited.

<warning>You should never try to modify player customized spawnlists!</warning>

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: A unique classname of the list.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the category displayed to the player, e.g. `Comic Props`.

arguments.name: contents
arguments.description:
A table of entries for the spawn menu. It must be numerically indexed. Each member of the table is a sub-table containing a type member, and other members depending on the type. New content types can be added via spawnmenu.AddContentType. | string type | Description | Other members | | ------------- | ---------- | ----------------- | | "header" | a simple header for organization | string text - The text that the header will display | | "model" | spawns a model where the player is looking | string model - The path to the model file
number skin - The skin for the model to use (optional)
string body - The bodygroups for the model (optional)
number wide - The width of the spawnicon (optional)
number tall - The height of the spawnicon (optional) | | "entity" | spawns an entity where the player is looking
(appears in the Entities tab by default) | string spawnname - The filename of the entity, for example "sent_ball"
string nicename - The name of the entity to display
string material - The icon to display, this should be set to `entities/[sent_name].png`
boolean admin - Whether the entity is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "vehicle" | spawns a vehicle where the player is looking
(appears in the Vehicles tab by default) | string spawnname - The filename of the vehicle
string nicename - The name of the vehicle to display
string material - The icon to display
boolean admin - Whether the vehicle is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "npc" | spawns an NPC where the player is looking
(appears in the NPCs tab by default) | string spawnname - The spawn name of the NPC
string nicename - The name to display
string material - The icon to display
table weapon - A table of potential weapons (each a string) to give to the NPC.
When spawned, one of these will be chosen randomly each time.
boolean admin - Whether the NPC is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "weapon" | When clicked, gives the player a weapon;
When middle-clicked, spawns a weapon where the player is looking
(appears in the Weapons tab by default) |string spawnname - The spawn name of the weapon
string nicename - The name to display
string material - The icon to display
boolean admin - Whether the weapon is only spawnable by admins (optional) |

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: The icon to use in the tree.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The unique ID number for the spawnlist category. Used to make sub categories. See "parentID" parameter below. If not set, it will be automatically set to ever increasing number, starting with 1000.

arguments.name: parentID
arguments.description: The unique ID of the parent category. This will make the created category a subcategory of category with given unique ID. `0` makes this a base category (such as `Builder`).

arguments.name: needsApp
arguments.description: The needed game for this prop category, if one is needed. If the specified game is not mounted, the category isn't shown. This uses the shortcut name, e.g. `cstrike`, and not the Steam AppID.

name: sql
description:
The SQL library allows you to access powerful database software included with Garry's Mod. It is the preferred and fastest method of storing large amounts of data. The database is located in sv.db serverside and cl.db clientside, both in the Garry's Mod base folder. SQL is a whole scripting language in itself although relatively simple, it's something you'll need to read up on before using this library.


Example of using sql.
```
-- Creating a table
sql.Query("CREATE TABLE my_db_table( id NUMBER , name TEXT )" )

-- Inserting a value to the table
sql.Query("INSERT INTO my_db_table( id , name ) VALUES( 1 , 'First') ")

-- Printing the tables data
PrintTable( sql.Query("SELECT * FROM my_db_table ") )

-- Deleting the table
sql.Query("DROP TABLE my_db_table")
```

Known GMod [SQLite](https://www.sqlite.org/compile.html) settings:
* Temp files are stored in memory (`SQLITE_TEMP_STORE = 3`)
* No `ATTACH` and `DETACH` operations (`SQLITE_OMIT_ATTACH = 1`)
* No Virtual Tables (`SQLITE_OMIT_VIRTUALTABLE = 1`)
* No `VACUUM` operation (`SQLITE_OMIT_VACUUM = 1`)
* No `LIMIT` and `ORDER BY` clauses in `DELETE` and `UPDATE` statements (`SQLITE_ENABLE_UPDATE_DELETE_LIMIT`)

functions.name: Begin
functions.description:
Tells the engine a set of queries is coming. Will wait until sql.Commit is called to run them.
This is most useful when you run more than 100+ queries.
This is equivalent to : ``` sql.Query( "BEGIN;" ) ```

functions.name: Commit
functions.description:
Tells the engine to execute a series of queries queued for execution, must be preceded by <page>sql.Begin</page>.

This is equivalent to `sql.Query( "COMMIT;" )`.

functions.name: IndexExists
functions.description: Returns true if the index with the specified name exists.

arguments.description: The name of the index to check.

functions.name: LastError
functions.description: Returns the last error from a SQLite query.

functions.name: Query
functions.description:
Performs a query on the local SQLite database, returns a table as result set, nil if result is empty and false on error.
<warning>
To run SQL queries with this function safely, it is crucial to ensure that the concatenated variables in the query string are safe to avoid vulnerabilities like SQL injections. For this, it is recommended to use the <page>sql.SQLStr</page>, which allows arguments to be escaped correctly.
</warning>

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The query to execute.

returnValues.description: false is returned if there is an error, nil if the query returned no data.

functions.name: QueryRow
functions.description:
Performs the <page>sql.Query</page> and returns the n'th row.

This function is equivalent to safely returning
```lua
sql.Query(query)[row]
```

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The query as used in sql.Query

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: The row number.

functions.name: QueryValue
functions.description: Performs the query like <page>sql.QueryRow</page>, but returns the first value found.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The input query.

arguments.name: tableName
arguments.description: The name of the table to check.

functions.name: Download

<note>You really should be using <page>steamworks.DownloadUGC</page>. This is a legacy function.</note>

Downloads a file from the supplied addon and saves it as a `.cache` file in `garrysmod/cache/` folder.

This is mostly used to download the preview image of the addon.

In case the retrieved file is an image and you need the <page>IMaterial</page>, use <page>Global.AddonMaterial</page> with the path supplied from the callback.

You will usually want to set this to true.

</callback>

name: string
description:
The string *type* is a sequence of characters. The string *library* is a standard Lua library which provides functions for the manipulation of strings.[[1]](https://www.lua.org/pil/20.html) In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions and features added to this library.
Most notably all strings will access this library through the string metatable index function.[[2]](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/lua/includes/extensions/string.lua#L311-L322) This means all strings are treated like table objects and the string library as its Meta_Tables ```lua local x = "Kittens" function string.Foobar(self) return self:Right(4) end string.Right(x,4) == x:Right(4) == x:Foobar() == ("Kittens"):Right(4) == x[-4]..x[-3]..x[-2]..x[-1] ``` The string *metatable* however is something else, and to access that you must use `getmetatable("")`. The difference here is related to Metamethods, such as using (+) instead of (..) to concatenate strings. Using `+` operator for concatenation breaks lua metamethod to sum string as numbers (Example: `"10" + "1"` return `11` (number)) and this is 400 times SLOWER! ```lua local stringmeta = getmetatable("") function stringmeta.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- This will work function string.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- But this will not. print("Kittens" + " And " + "Puppies") ``` See Meta Tables and Metamethods for more information. Making changes to the string *metatable* is not a good idea unless you know what you are doing. Use the string *library* instead. This category lists functions available in the string *library*.

functions.name: byte
functions.description:
Returns the given string's characters in their numeric ASCII representation.
<warning>This function will throw an error if the slice length is greater than 8000 characters.</warning>

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string to get the chars from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The first character of the string to get the byte of.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The last character of the string to get the byte of.

functions.name: CardinalToOrdinal
functions.description:
Converts a cardinal (`111`) number to its [ordinal/sequential variation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordinal_numeral) (`111th`).

See also <page>Global.STNDRD</page> for a function that returns just the suffix.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: A number to convert to ordinal.

functions.name: char
functions.description: Takes the given numerical bytes and converts them to a string.

arguments.name: bytes
arguments.description: The bytes to create the string from.

functions.name: Comma
functions.description: Inserts commas for every third digit of a given number.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The input number to commafy

arguments.name: separator
arguments.description: An optional string that will be used instead of the default comma.

functions.name: dump
functions.description:
Returns the binary bytecode of the given function.

<note>This does not work with functions created in C/C++. An error will be thrown if it is</note>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to get the bytecode of

arguments.name: stripDebugInfo
arguments.description: True to strip the debug data, false to keep it

functions.description: Returns whether or not the second passed string matches the end of the first.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string whose end is to be checked.

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: The string to be matched with the end of the first.

returnValues.description: `true` if the first string ends with the second, or the second is empty, otherwise `false`.

functions.name: Explode
functions.description:
Splits a string up wherever it finds the given separator.

The function <page>string.Split</page> is an alias of this function, except that function doesn't support using patterns.

See <page>string.Implode</page> for the reverse operation of this function.

arguments.name: separator
arguments.description: The string will be separated wherever this sequence is found.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to split up.

arguments.name: withpattern
arguments.description: Set this to true if your separator is a <page text="pattern">Patterns</page>.

returnValues.description: Exploded string as a numerical sequential table.

functions.name: find
functions.description:
Attempts to find the specified substring in a string.

<warning>This function uses <page text="Lua Patterns">Patterns</page> by default.</warning>

arguments.name: haystack
arguments.description: The string to search in.

arguments.name: needle
arguments.description: The string to find, can contain patterns if enabled.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The position to start the search from, can be negative start position will be relative to the end position.

arguments.name: noPatterns
arguments.description: Disable patterns.

returnValues.description: Starting position of the found text, or nil if the text wasn't found
Ending position of found text, or nil if the text wasn't found
Matched text for each group if patterns are enabled and used, or nil if the text wasn't found

functions.name: format
functions.description: Formats the specified values into the string given.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description:
The string to be formatted.
Follows this format: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdio/printf/ The following features are not supported in Lua: * The `n` specifier * The `*` width modifier * The `.*` precision modifier * All length modifiers The following specifiers are exclusive to LuaJIT: | Format | Description | Example of the output | |:------:|:-----------:|:---------------------:| | %p | Returns pointer to supplied structure (table/function) | `0xf20a8968` | | %q | Formats a string between double quotes, using escape sequences when necessary to ensure that it can safely be read back by the Lua interpreter | `"test\1\2test"` |

arguments.name: formatParameters
arguments.description: Values to be formatted into the string.

functions.name: FormattedTime
functions.description: Returns the time as a formatted string or as a table if no format is given.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The time in seconds to format.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: An optional formatting to use. If no format it specified, a table will be returned instead.

returnValues.description:
Returns the time as a formatted string only if a format was specified.

Returns a table only if no format was specified. The table will contain these fields:
* <page>number</page> ms - milliseconds
* <page>number</page> s - seconds
* <page>number</page> m - minutes
* <page>number</page> h - hours

functions.name: FromColor
functions.description: Creates a string from a Color variable.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to put in the string.

arguments.description: The string that you will be searching with the supplied index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index's value of the string to be returned.

Use <page>string.gmatch</page> instead.</deprecated>Returns an iterator function that is called for every complete match of the pattern, all sub matches will be passed as to the loop.

arguments.name: pattern

functions.name: gmatch
functions.description: Using <page>Patterns</page>, returns an iterator which will return either one value if no capture groups are defined, or any capture group matches.

arguments.name: data

arguments.name: pattern

returnValues.description: The iterator function that can be used in a for-in loop

functions.name: gsub
functions.description: This functions main purpose is to replace certain character sequences in a string using <page>Patterns</page>.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: String which should be modified.

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.description: The pattern that defines what should be matched and eventually be replaced.

arguments.name: replacement
arguments.description:
In case of a string the matched sequence will be replaced with it.

In case of a table, the matched sequence will be used as key and the table will tested for the key, if a value exists it will be used as replacement.

In case of a function all matches will be passed as parameters to the function, the return value(s) of the function will then be used as replacement.

arguments.name: maxReplaces
arguments.description: Maximum number of replacements to be made.

functions.name: Implode
functions.description:
<deprecated>You really should just use <page>table.concat</page>.</deprecated>

Joins the values of a table together to form a string.

This is the reverse of <page>string.Explode</page> and is functionally identical to <page>table.concat</page>, but with less features.

arguments.name: separator
arguments.description: The separator to insert between each piece.

arguments.name: pieces
arguments.description: The table of pieces to concatenate. The keys for these must be numeric and sequential.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to convert.

returnValues.description: A string representing the value of a string converted to upper-case.

name: surface
description: The surface library allows you to draw text and shapes on the screen. Primarily used for making HUDs & custom GUI panels.

functions.name: CreateFont
functions.description:
Creates a new font.

To prevent the font from displaying incorrectly when using the `outline` setting, set `antialias` to false. This will ensure the text properly fills out the entire outline.

Be sure to check the <page text="List of Default Fonts">Default_Fonts</page> first! Those fonts can be used without using this function.

See Also: <page>Finding the Font Name</page>.

<warning>Due to the static nature of fonts, do **NOT** create the font more than once. You should only be creating them once, it is recommended to create them at the top of your script. Do not use this function within <page>GM:HUDPaint</page> or any other hook!

Define fonts that you will actually use, as fonts are very taxing on performance and will cause crashes! Do not create fonts for every size.</warning>

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description: The new font name.

arguments.name: fontData
arguments.description: The font properties. See the <page>Structures/FontData</page>.

functions.name: DisableClipping
functions.description: Alias of Global.DisableClipping so use that instead. Enables or disables the clipping used by the VGUI that limits the drawing operations to a panels bounds. Identical to Global.DisableClipping. See also Panel:NoClipping.

arguments.name: disable
arguments.description: True to disable, false to enable the clipping

returnValues.name: oldState
returnValues.description: Whether the clipping was enabled or not before this function call

functions.name: DrawCircle
functions.description:
Draws a hollow circle, made of lines. For a filled circle, see examples for <page>surface.DrawPoly</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: originX
arguments.description: The center x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: originY
arguments.description: The center y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the circle.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of the color to draw the circle with, or a <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

functions.name: DrawLine
functions.description:
Draws a line from one point to another.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: startX
arguments.description: The start x float coordinate.

arguments.name: startY
arguments.description: The start y float coordinate.

arguments.name: endX
arguments.description: The end x float coordinate.

arguments.name: endY
arguments.description: The end y float coordinate.

functions.name: DrawOutlinedRect
functions.description:
Draws a hollow box with a given border width.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The start x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The start y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The integer width.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The integer height.

arguments.name: thickness
arguments.description: The thickness of the outlined box border.

functions.name: DrawPoly
functions.description:
Draws a textured polygon (secretly a triangle fan) with a maximum of 4096 vertices.
Only works properly with convex polygons. You may try to render concave polygons, but there is no guarantee that things wont get messed up.

Unlike most surface library functions, non-integer coordinates are not rounded.

<warning>You must reset the drawing color and texture before calling the function to ensure consistent results. See examples below.</warning>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: vertices
arguments.description:
A table containing integer vertices. See the <page>Structures/PolygonVertex</page>.

**The vertices must be in clockwise order.**

functions.name: DrawRect
functions.description:
Draws a solid rectangle on the screen.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

functions.name: DrawText
functions.description:
Draw the specified text on the screen, using the previously set [position](surface.SetTextPos), [font](surface.SetFont) and [color](surface.SetTextColor). This function does **not** handle newlines.

This function moves the [text position](surface.SetTextPos) by the length of the drawn text - this can be used to change text properties (such as font or color) without having to manually recalculate the text position. See example #2 for example use of this behavior.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text to be rendered.

arguments.name: forceAdditive
arguments.description:
`true` to force text to render additive, `false` to force not additive, `nil` to use font's value.

When additive rendering is enabled, the rendered text pixels will be added to the existing screen pixels, rather than replacing them outright. This means black text will be invisible, and drawing on a pure white background will be impossible.

<upload src="70c/8db6ce804200a43.png" size="21270" name="image.png">
</upload>

functions.name: DrawTexturedRect
functions.description:
Draw a textured rectangle with the given position and dimensions on the screen, using the current active texture set with <page>surface.SetMaterial</page>. It is also affected by <page>surface.SetDrawColor</page>.

See also <page>render.SetMaterial</page> and <page>render.DrawScreenQuadEx</page>.
See also <page>surface.DrawTexturedRectUV</page> and <page>surface.DrawTexturedRectRotated</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

functions.name: DrawTexturedRectRotated
functions.description:
Draw a textured rotated rectangle with the given position and dimensions and angle on the screen, using the current active texture.

See also <page>surface.DrawTexturedRectUV</page> and <page>surface.DrawTexturedRect</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate, representing the center of the rectangle.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate, representing the center of the rectangle.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: The rotation of the rectangle, in degrees.

functions.name: DrawTexturedRectUV
functions.description:
Draws a textured rectangle with a repeated or partial texture.

`u` and `v` refer to texture coordinates.
* (u, v) = (0, 0) is the top left
* (u, v) = (1, 0) is the top right
* (u, v) = (1, 1) is the bottom right
* (u, v) = (0, 1) is the bottom left

Using a start point of (1, 0) and an end point to (0, 1), you can draw an image flipped horizontally, same goes with other directions. Going above 1 will tile the texture. Negative values are allowed as well.

Here's a helper image:
<upload src="70c/8d7bba248dc08bd.png" size="183359" name="image.png">

See also <page>surface.DrawTexturedRect</page> and <page>surface.DrawTexturedRectRotated</page>.

<note>If you are using a .png image, you need supply the "noclamp" flag as second parameter for <page>Global.Material</page> if you intend to use tiling.</note>

<note>If you find that `surface.DrawTexturedRectUV` is getting your texture coordinates (u0, v0), (u1, v1) wrong and you're rendering with a material created with <page>Global.CreateMaterial</page>, try adjusting them with the following code:

```
local du = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection
local dv = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection
local u0, v0 = (u0 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v0 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)
local u1, v1 = (u1 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v1 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)
```


**Explanation:**
`surface.DrawTexturedRectUV` tries to correct the texture coordinates by half a pixel (something to do with sampling) and computes the correction using `IMaterial::GetMappingWidth()`/`GetMappingHeight()`. If the material was created without a `$basetexture`, then `GetMappingWidth()`/`GetMappingHeight()` uses the width and height of the error material (which is 32x32).</note>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

<bug issue="3173">The UV offsets might require (sub-)pixel correction for accurate tiling results.</bug>
</upload>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: startU
arguments.description: The U texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

arguments.name: startV
arguments.description: The V texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

arguments.name: endU
arguments.description: The U texture mapping of the rectangle end.

arguments.name: endV
arguments.description: The V texture mapping of the rectangle end.

functions.name: GetAlphaMultiplier
functions.description: Returns the current alpha multiplier affecting drawing operations. This is set by <page>surface.SetAlphaMultiplier</page> or by the game engine in certain other cases.

functions.name: GetDrawColor
functions.description:
Returns the current color affecting draw operations.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: The color that drawing operations will use as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetHUDTexture
functions.description:
Returns the [HUD icon](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/hud_textures.txt) TextureID of a texture with the specified name.

You probably want to use <page>Global.Material</page> and <page>surface.SetMaterial</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the texture.

returnValues.name: texID
returnValues.description: The texture ID, for use with <page>surface.SetTexture</page>.

functions.name: GetPanelPaintState
functions.description:
Retrieves the position and <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> information for the <page>Panel</page> that is currently being drawn.

When using the <page>surface</page> library (and, by extension, the <page>draw</page> library) inside of the <page>PANEL:Paint</page> function, the origin (The on-screen position of `(0,0)`) is automatically shifted to the top-left corner of the panel to make it easier to draw the panel's contents.  Additionally, <page>render.SetScissorRect</page> is used to clip (or "mask") all drawn content to within the boundaries of the panel.  This function returns the information used by the <page>surface</page> library about the current panel's origin and <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page>.

returnValues.description:
A table containing the position and <page text="ScissorRect">render.SetScissorRect</page> boundaries for the <page>Panel</page> currently being drawn.

For the table's format and available options see the <page>Structures/PanelPaintState</page> page.

functions.name: GetTextColor
functions.description:
Returns the current color affecting text draw operations.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: The color that text drawing operations will use as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetTextPos
functions.description: Returns the X and Y co-ordinate that has been set with <page>surface.SetTextPos</page> or changed by <page>surface.DrawText</page>.

functions.name: GetTextSize
functions.description:
Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the given text with the font that has been set with <page>surface.SetFont</page>.

<validate>
Does not take into account new lines, the returned height is for the entire font (as specified by the font), not maximum of individual characters.</validate>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The string to check the size of.

functions.name: GetTextureID
functions.description:
Returns the texture id of the material with the given name/path, for use with <page>surface.SetTexture</page>.

Opposite version of this function is <page>surface.GetTextureNameByID</page>.

<note>This function will not work with .png or .jpg images. For that, see <page>Global.Material</page>. You will probably want to use it regardless.</note>

arguments.name: name/path
arguments.description: Name or path of the texture.

functions.name: GetTextureNameByID
functions.description: Returns name/path of texture by ID. Opposite version of this function is <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: ID of texture.

functions.name: GetTextureSize
functions.description:
Returns the size of the texture with the associated texture ID.

For `.png/.jpg` textures loaded with <page>Global.Material</page> you can use the `$realheight` and `$realwidth` material parameters (<page>IMaterial:GetInt</page>) to get the size of the image.

arguments.name: textureID
arguments.description: The texture ID, returned by <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>.

functions.name: PlaySound
functions.description:
Play a sound file directly on the client (such as UI sounds, etc).

<note>
Valid sample rates: **11025 Hz, 22050 Hz and 44100 Hz**, otherwise you may see this kind of message:

`Unsupported 32-bit wave file your_sound.wav` and
`Invalid sample rate (48000) for sound 'your_sound.wav'`
</note>

arguments.name: soundfile
arguments.description:
The path to the sound file.

This should either be a sound script name (<page>sound.Add</page>) or a file path relative to the `sound/` folder. (Make note that it's not sound**s**)

functions.name: ScreenHeight
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Global.ScrH</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns the height of the current client's screen.

functions.name: ScreenWidth
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Global.ScrW</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns the width of the current client's screen.

functions.name: SetAlphaMultiplier
functions.description:
Sets the alpha multiplier that will influence all upcoming drawing operations.
See also <page>render.SetBlend</page>.

arguments.name: multiplier
arguments.description: The multiplier ranging from 0 to 1.

functions.name: SetDrawColor
functions.description:
Set the color of any future shapes to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate values or by a <page>Color</page>.

<note>The alpha value may not work properly if you're using a material without `$vertexalpha`.</note>
<note>Due to post processing and gamma correction the color you set with this function may appear differently when rendered. This problem does not occur on materials drawn with <page>surface.DrawTexturedRect</page>.</note>

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of color.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of color.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of color.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: A <page>Color</page> object/table to read the color from. This is slower than providing four numbers. You could use <page>Color:Unpack</page> to address this. You should also cache your color objects if you wish to use them, for performance reasons.

functions.name: SetFont
functions.description:
Set the current font to be used for text operations later.

The fonts must first be created with <page>surface.CreateFont</page> or be one of the <page>Default Fonts</page>.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description: The name of the font to use.

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the material to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

Not to be confused with <page>render.SetMaterial</page>.

If you need to unset the texture, use the <page>draw.NoTexture</page> convenience function.

<warning><page>Global.Material</page> function calls are expensive to be done inside this function or inside rendering context, you should be caching the results of <page>Global.Material</page> calls</warning>

arguments.name: material
arguments.description:
The material to be used.

<note>When using <page>render.PushRenderTarget</page> or <page>render.SetRenderTarget</page>, the material should have the `$ignorez` flag set to make it visible. If the material is not used in 3D rendering, it is probably safe to add it with this code:
```lua
material:SetInt( "$flags", bit.bor( material:GetInt( "$flags" ), 32768 ) )
```

If using <page>Global.Material</page>, simply use the `ignorez` parameter.
</note>

functions.name: SetTextColor
functions.description: Set the color of any future text to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate numbers or by a <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of color.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of color

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of color

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of color

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: A <page>Color</page> object/table to read the color from. This is slower than providing four numbers. You could use <page>Color:Unpack</page> to address this. You should also cache your color objects if you wish to use them, for performance reasons.

functions.name: SetTextPos
functions.description: Set the top-left position to draw any future text at.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

functions.name: SetTexture
functions.description:
Sets the texture to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

This is a legacy method, and should probably not be used, see <page>surface.SetMaterial</page> and <page>IMaterial</page> for a better alternative.

arguments.name: textureID
arguments.description: The ID of the texture to draw with returned by <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>.

name: system
description: The system library provides functions that allow you to gather information about the system running the game, such as operating system, uptime and battery level.

functions.name: AppTime
functions.description:
Returns the total uptime of the current application as reported by Steam.

This will return a similar value to <page>Global.SysTime</page>.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

returnValues.description: Seconds of game uptime as an integer.

functions.name: BatteryPower
functions.description: Returns the current battery power.

returnValues.description:
0-100 if a battery (laptop, UPS, etc) is present.

Will instead return 255 if plugged in without a battery.

functions.name: FlashWindow
functions.description: Flashes the window, turning the border to white briefly

functions.name: GetCountry
functions.description:
Returns the country code of this computer, determined by the localisation settings of the OS.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

functions.name: HasFocus
functions.description:
Returns whether or not the game window has focus.

<note>This function does not work on dedicated servers and will instead return no value.</note>

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game window has focus.

functions.name: IsLinux
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is Linux.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game is running on Linux.

functions.name: IsOSX
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is OSX.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game is running on OSX.

functions.name: IsWindowed
functions.description: Returns whether the game is being run in a window or in fullscreen (you can change this by opening the menu, clicking 'Options', then clicking the 'Video' tab, and changing the Display Mode using the dropdown menu):

returnValues.description: Is the game running in a window?

functions.name: IsWindows
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is Windows.

returnValues.description: Whether the system the game runs on is Windows or not.

functions.name: SteamTime
functions.description:
Returns the synchronized Steam time. This is the number of seconds since the [Unix epoch](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

functions.name: UpTime
functions.description:
Returns the amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

This is a direct binding to ISteamUtils->GetSecondsSinceComputerActive, and is most likely related to Steam's automatic "Away" online status.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

name: table
description:
The <page text="table">Beginner_Tutorial_Tables</page> **type** is an object that can store multiple values.

The table **library** is a standard Lua library which provides functions to manipulate tables. In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions added to this library.

This category lists the functions available in the table `library`.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Adds all values from `source` table into the `target` table. This is most useful for sequential tables, not "dictionary" or "map" tables. See <page>table.Merge</page> if you want to merge 2 tables into one.

See <page>table.insert</page> for a function that adds a single value, and <page>table.Inherit</page> for a function that inherits keys from one table to another.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The table to insert the new values into.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The table to retrieve the values from.

functions.name: ClearKeys
functions.description: Changes all keys to sequential integers. This creates a new table object and does not affect the original.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The original table to modify.

arguments.name: saveKeys
arguments.description: Save the keys within each member table. This will insert a new field `__key` into each value, and should not be used if the table contains non-table values.

functions.name: CollapseKeyValue
functions.description: Collapses a table with keyvalue structure

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: Input table

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenates the contents of a table to a string.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to concatenate.

arguments.name: concatenator
arguments.description: A separator to insert between strings

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The key to start at

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The key to end at

functions.name: Copy
functions.description:
Creates a deep copy and returns that copy.

<warning>This function does NOT copy userdata, such as <page>Vector</page>s and <page>Angle</page>s!</warning>

arguments.name: originalTable
arguments.description: The table to be copied.

returnValues.description: A deep copy of the original table

functions.name: CopyFromTo
functions.description: Empties the target table, and merges all values from the source table into it.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The table to copy from.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The table to write to.

functions.name: Count
functions.description:
Counts the amount of keys in a table. This should only be used when a table is not numerically and sequentially indexed. For those tables, consider the length (**#**) operator.

If you only want to test if the table is empty or not, use <page>table.IsEmpty</page> instead as it is a lot faster.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to count the keys of.

returnValues.description: The number of keyvalue pairs. This includes non-numeric and non-sequential keys, unlike the length (**#**) operator.

functions.name: DeSanitise
functions.description: Converts a table that has been sanitised with <page>table.Sanitise</page> back to its original form

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to be de-sanitised

functions.name: Empty
functions.description: Removes all values from a table. If your table is not a metatable, it is almost always better to use `tab = {}` to preserve performance.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to empty.

functions.name: FindNext
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, iterate the table using ipairs or increment from the previous index using <page>Global.next</page>. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.</deprecated>
Returns the value positioned after the supplied value in a table. If it isn't found then the first element in the table is returned

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to search

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to return element after

functions.name: FindPrev
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, iterate your table with ipairs, storing the previous value and checking for the target. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.</deprecated>
Returns the value positioned before the supplied value in a table. If it isn't found then the last element in the table is returned

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to search

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to return element before

functions.name: Flip
functions.description:
Flips key-value pairs of each element within a table, so that each value becomes the key, and each key becomes the value.

<warning>Take care when using this function, as a Lua table cannot contain multiple instances of the same key. As such, data loss is possible when using this function on tables with duplicate values.

```
local test = { test = 1, test2 = 1 }
local f = table.Flip( test )
PrintTable( f )
-- Outputs "1	=	test2"
```
</warning>

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: The table to flip items of.

functions.name: ForceInsert
functions.description: Inserts a value in to the given table even if the table is non-existent

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to insert value in to

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to insert

functions.name: foreach
functions.description:
<deprecated>This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use <page>Global.pairs</page> instead.</deprecated> Iterates for each key-value pair in the table, calling the function with the key and value of the pair. If the function returns anything, the loop is broken.

The GLua interpretation of this is <page>table.ForEach</page>.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to iterate over.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to run for each key and value.

<callback>
<arg name="key" type="any">The key of a key-value pair for this iteration.</arg>
<arg name="val" type="any">The value of a key-value pair for this iteration.</arg>
</callback>

functions.name: foreachi
functions.description:
<deprecated>This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use <page>Global.ipairs</page>() instead.</deprecated> Iterates for each numeric index in the table in order.

This is inherited from the original Lua implementation and is deprecated in Lua as of 5.1; see [here](http://lua-users.org/wiki/TableLibraryTutorial). You should use <page>Global.ipairs</page>() instead.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table to iterate over.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to run for each index.

functions.name: GetFirstKey
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, expect the first key to be 1.

Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a first key.</deprecated>
Returns the first key found in the given table

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to retrieve key from

functions.name: GetFirstValue
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, index the table with a key of 1.

Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a first key.</deprecated>
Returns the first value found in the given table

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to retrieve value from

functions.name: GetKeys
functions.description: Returns all keys of a table.

arguments.name: tabl
arguments.description: The table to get keys of

functions.name: GetLastKey
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, use the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.</deprecated>
Returns the last key found in the given table

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to retrieve key from

functions.name: GetLastValue
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, index the table with the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.</deprecated>
Returns the last value found in the given table

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to retrieve value from

functions.name: getn
functions.description: <deprecated>This function was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and is removed in 5.2. Use the length (#) operator instead.</deprecated> Returns the length of the table.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to check.

functions.name: GetWinningKey
functions.description: Returns a key of the supplied table with the highest number value.

arguments.name: inputTable
arguments.description: The table to search in.

functions.name: HasValue
functions.description:
Checks if a table has a value.
<warning>This function is **very inefficient for large tables** (O(n)) and should probably not be called in things that run each frame. Instead, consider a table structure such as example 2 below. Also see: <page>Tables: Bad Habits</page></warning>
<note>For optimization, functions that look for a value by sorting the table should never be needed if you work on a table that you built yourself.</note>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to check

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to search for

returnValues.description: Returns true if the table has that value, false otherwise

functions.name: Inherit
functions.description:
Copies any missing data from `base` to `target`, and sets the `target`'s `BaseClass` member to the `base` table's pointer.

See <page>table.Merge</page>, which overrides existing values and doesn't add a BaseClass member.


See also <page>table.Add</page>, which simply adds values of one table to another.

<bug pull="1304">Sub-tables aren't inherited. The target's table value will take priority.</bug>

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: Table to copy data to

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Table to copy data from

functions.name: insert
functions.description:
Inserts a value into a table at the end of the table or at the given position.
<note>This function does not call the `__newindex` [metamethod](Metamethods).</note>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to insert the variable into.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position in the table to insert the variable. If the third argument is nil this argument becomes the value to insert at the end of given table.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The variable to insert into the table.

returnValues.description: The index the object was placed at.

functions.name: IsEmpty
functions.description:
Returns whether or not the given table is empty.

This works on both sequential and non-sequential tables, and is a lot faster for non-sequential tables than `table.Count(tbl) == 0`.
If you want to check if a table is not empty, use `next(tbl) ~= nil`, as it is slightly faster.

For sequential tables it is better to use `tab[1] ~= nil`.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to check.

functions.name: IsSequential
functions.description: Returns whether or not the table's keys are sequential

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to check

functions.name: KeyFromValue
functions.description: Returns the first key found to be containing the supplied value

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to search

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to search for

functions.name: KeysFromValue
functions.description: Returns a table of keys containing the supplied value

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to search

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to search for

functions.name: LowerKeyNames
functions.description: Returns a copy of the input table with all string keys converted to be lowercase recursively

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to convert

functions.name: maxn
functions.description: Returns the highest numerical key.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to search.

functions.name: MemberValuesFromKey
functions.description:
Returns an array of values of given with given key from each table of given table.

See also <page>table.KeysFromValue</page>.

arguments.name: inputTable
arguments.description: The table to search in.

arguments.name: keyName
arguments.description: The key to lookup.

returnValues.description: A list of found values, or an empty table.

functions.name: Merge
functions.description:
Recursively merges the key-value pairs of the `source` table with the key-value pairs in the `destination` table.

See <page>table.Inherit</page>, which doesn't override existing values.


See also <page>table.Add</page>, which simply adds values of one table to another.
<note>This function can cause a stack overflow under certain circumstances.</note>

arguments.name: destination
arguments.description: The table you want the source table to merge with.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The table you want to merge with the destination table.

arguments.name: forceOverride
arguments.description: If `true`, does not recursively merge sub-tables, and simply replaces them.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves elements from one part of a table to another part a given table. This is similar to assigning elements from the source table to the destination table in multiple assignments.

arguments.name: sourceTbl
arguments.description: The source table from which the elements are to be moved.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: The start index of the source range from which the elements are to be moved.

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The end index of the source range until which the elements are to be moved.

arguments.name: dest
arguments.description: The index within the destination table where the moved elements should be inserted.

arguments.name: destTbl
arguments.description: The destination table to which the elements are to be moved. By default, this is the same as the source table.

functions.name: Pack
functions.description: Packs a set of items into a table and returns the new table. It is meant as an alternative implementation of `table.pack` from newer versions of Lua.

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: The items to pack into a table.

returnValues.description: The amount of items that were added to the table.

functions.name: Random
functions.description:
Returns a random value from the supplied table.

<warning>This function iterates over the given table **twice**, therefore with sequential tables you should instead use following:

```
mytable[ math.random( #mytable ) ]
```
</warning>

arguments.name: haystack
arguments.description: The table to choose from.

returnValues.description: A random value from the table.
The key associated with the random value.

functions.name: remove
functions.description:
Removes a value from a table and shifts any other values down to fill the gap.
<note>Does nothing if index is less than 1 or greater than `#tbl`</note>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to remove the value from.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the value to remove.

functions.name: RemoveByValue
functions.description:
Removes the first instance of a given value from the specified table with <page>table.remove</page>, then returns the key that the value was found at.

<warning>Avoid usage of this function. It does not remove all instances of given value in the table, only the first found, and it does not work with non sequential tables!</warning>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table that will be searched.

arguments.name: val
arguments.description: The value to find within the table.

returnValues.description: The key at which the value was found, or false if the value was not found.

functions.name: Reverse
functions.description: Returns a reversed copy of a sequential table. Any non-sequential and non-numeric keyvalue pairs will not be copied.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to reverse.

returnValues.description: A reversed copy of the table.

functions.name: Sanitise
functions.description:
Converts <page>Vector</page>s, <page>Angle</page>s and <page>boolean</page>s to be able to be converted to and from key-values via <page>util.TableToKeyValues</page>.

<page>table.DeSanitise</page> performs the opposite transformation.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to sanitise

functions.name: Shuffle
functions.description: Performs an inline [Fisher-Yates shuffle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisher%E2%80%93Yates_shuffle) on the table in `O(n)` time

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The table to shuffle.

functions.name: sort
functions.description:
Sorts a sequential table either ascending or by the given sort function.
<note>This function modifies the table you give to it and internally uses the [quick sort algorithm](http://www.lua.org/source/5.2/ltablib.c.html#sort).</note>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to sort.

arguments.name: sorter
arguments.description:
If specified, the sorting function.

<callback>
<arg name="a" type="any">Item A to test.</arg>
<arg name="b" type="any">Item B to test.</arg>
<ret name="result" type="boolean">Result of the comparison. Return true in this function if you want the first parameter to come first in the sorted array.</ret>
</callback>

functions.name: SortByKey
functions.description:
Returns a list of keys sorted based on values of those keys.

For normal sorting see <page>table.sort</page>.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to sort. All values of this table must be of same type.

arguments.name: descending
arguments.description: Should the order be descending?

returnValues.description: A table of keys sorted by values from supplied table.

functions.name: SortByMember
functions.description: Sorts a table by a named member.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: Table to sort.

arguments.name: memberKey
arguments.description: The key used to identify the member.

arguments.name: ascending
arguments.description: Whether or not the order should be ascending.

functions.name: SortDesc
functions.description:
Sorts a table in reverse order from <page>table.sort</page>.
<note>This function modifies the table you give to it. Like table.sort, it does not return anything.</note>

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to sort in descending order.

functions.name: ToString
functions.description: Converts a table into a string

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to iterate over.

arguments.name: displayName
arguments.description: Optional. A name for the table.

arguments.name: niceFormatting
arguments.description: Adds new lines and tabs to the string.

returnValues.description: The table formatted as a string.

name: team
description: The team library gives you access to the team system built into the Source engine, and allows you to create custom teams and get information about them.

functions.name: AddScore
functions.description: Increases the score of the given team

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Index of the team

arguments.name: increment
arguments.description: Amount to increase the team's score by

functions.name: BestAutoJoinTeam
functions.description: Returns the team index of the team with the least players. Falls back to TEAM_UNASSIGNED

functions.name: GetAllTeams
functions.description: Returns the real table consisting of information on every defined team

functions.name: GetClass
functions.description: Returns the selectable classes for the given team. This can be added to with <page>team.SetClass</page>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Index of the team

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description: Returns the team's color.

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Returns the name of the team.

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

returnValues.description: The team name. If the team is not defined, returns an empty string.

functions.name: GetPlayers
functions.description:
Returns a table with all player of the specified team.
<note>This function returns a sequential table, meaning it should be looped with <page>Global.ipairs</page> instead of <page>Global.pairs</page> for efficiency reasons.</note>

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

returnValues.description: A sequential table of <page>Player</page>s that belong to the requested team.

functions.name: GetScore
functions.description: Returns the score of the team.

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

functions.name: GetSpawnPoint
functions.description: Returns a table of valid spawnpoint classes the team can use. These are set with <page>team.SetSpawnPoint</page>.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Index of the team

functions.name: GetSpawnPoints

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Index of the team

functions.name: Joinable
functions.description: Returns if a team is joinable or not. This is set in <page>team.SetUp</page>.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the team.

returnValues.description: True if the team is joinable. False otherwise.

functions.name: NumPlayers

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

functions.description: Sets valid classes for use by a team. Classes can be created using <page>player_manager.RegisterClass</page>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Index of the team

arguments.name: classes
arguments.description: A class ID or table of class IDs

functions.name: SetColor

arguments.name: teamIndex
arguments.description: The team index.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The team's new color as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetScore
functions.description: Sets the score of the given team

arguments.description: Index of the team

Sets valid spawnpoint classes for use by a team.

<note>GM.TeamBased must be set to true for this to work</note>

arguments.name: classes
arguments.description: A spawnpoint classname or table of spawnpoint classnames

arguments.name: teamColor

name: timer
description: The timer library is a very useful set of functions which allow you to run a function periodically or after a given delay.

functions.name: Adjust
functions.description: Adjusts a previously created (<page>timer.Create</page>) timer with the given identifier.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to adjust.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay interval in seconds. **Must be specified.**

arguments.name: repetitions
arguments.description: Repetitions. Use `0` for infinite or `nil` to keep previous value.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The new function. Use `nil` to keep previous value.

functions.name: Check
functions.description: <deprecated>If you want to check if whether or not a timer exists, use <page>timer.Exists</page>.</deprecated> This function does nothing.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
Creates a new timer that will repeat its function given amount of times.
This function also requires the timer to be named, which allows you to control it after it was created via the <page>timer</page>.

For a simple one-time timer with no identifiers, see <page>timer.Simple</page>.

<warning>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless `sv_hibernate_think` is set to `1`).</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to create. Must be unique. If a timer already exists with the same identifier, that timer will be updated to the new settings and reset.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay interval in seconds. If the delay is too small, the timer will fire on the next <page>GM:Tick</page>.

arguments.name: repetitions
arguments.description: The number of times to repeat the timer. Enter `0` or any value below `0` for infinite repetitions.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: Function called when timer has finished the countdown.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: <deprecated>You should be using <page>timer.Remove</page> instead.</deprecated> Stops and destroys the given timer. Alias of <page>timer.Remove</page>.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to destroy.

functions.name: Exists
functions.description:
Returns whenever the given timer exists or not.

For debugging purposes you can use the following commands:
* `lua_dumptimers_cl`
* `lua_dumptimers_sv`
* `lua_dumptimers_menu`

These will list all active timers in each realm.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't

functions.name: Pause
functions.description: Pauses the given timer.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already paused, true otherwise.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description:
Stops and removes a timer created by <page>timer.Create</page>.
<warning>The timers are removed in the next frame! Keep this in mind when storing identifiers in variables.</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to remove.

functions.name: RepsLeft
functions.description: Returns amount of repetitions/executions left before the timer destroys itself.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

functions.name: Simple
functions.description:
Creates a simple timer that runs the given function after a specified delay.

For a more advanced version that you can control after creation, see <page>timer.Create</page>.

<warning>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless `sv_hibernate_think` is set to `1`).</warning>

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: How long until the function should be ran (in seconds). Use `0` to have the function run in the next <page>GM:Tick</page>.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to run after the specified delay.

functions.name: Start
functions.description:
Restarts the given timer.

<note>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> for timing.</note>
<warning>Timers won't advance while the client is timing out from the server.</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description: Stops the given timer and rewinds it.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already stopped, true otherwise.

functions.name: TimeLeft
functions.description:
Returns amount of time left (in seconds) before the timer executes its function.

<note>If the timer is paused, the amount will be negative.</note>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: The amount of time left (in seconds).

functions.name: Toggle
functions.description: Runs either <page>timer.Pause</page> or <page>timer.UnPause</page> based on the timer's current status.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

functions.name: UnPause
functions.description: Unpauses the timer.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already running, true otherwise.

name: umsg
description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> library instead</deprecated>

The umsg (user message) library was previously the most common way of sending information from the server to the client.

<warning>Usermessages have a limit of only 256 bytes!</warning>

functions.name: Angle
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Writes an angle to the usermessage.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: The angle to be sent.

functions.name: Bool
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Writes a bool to the usermessage.

arguments.name: bool
arguments.description: The bool to be sent.

functions.name: Char
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Writes a signed char to the usermessage.

arguments.name: char
arguments.description: The char to be sent.

functions.name: End
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Dispatches the usermessage to the client(s).

functions.name: Entity
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Writes an entity object to the usermessage.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The entity to be sent.

functions.name: Float
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Writes a float to the usermessage.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The float to be sent.

functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Writes a signed int (32 bit) to the usermessage.

arguments.name: int
arguments.description: The int to be sent.

functions.name: PoolString

<deprecated>Inferior version of <page>util.AddNetworkString</page></deprecated>

The string specified will be networked to the client and receive a identifying number, which will be sent instead of the string to optimize networking.

arguments.name: string

functions.name: Short

<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Writes a signed short (16 bit) to the usermessage.

arguments.name: short

functions.name: Start
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Starts a new usermessage.

<warning>Usermessages have a limit of only 256 bytes!</warning>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the message to be sent.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: If passed a player object, it will only be sent to the player, if passed a <page>CRecipientFilter</page> of players, it will be sent to all specified players, if passed `nil` (or another invalid value), the message will be sent to all players.

functions.name: String
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>
Writes a null terminated string to the usermessage.

functions.name: Vector
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Writes a Vector to the usermessage.
