functions.name: VectorNormal
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Writes a vector normal to the usermessage.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The vector normal to be sent.

name: undo
description: The undo library allows you to add custom entities to the undo list, allowing users to "undo" their creation with their undo (default: <key>Z</key>) key.

functions.name: AddEntity
functions.description: Adds an entity to the current undo block

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to add

functions.name: AddFunction
functions.description: Adds a function to call when the current undo block is undone. Note that if an undo has a function, the player will always be notified when this undo is performed, even if the entity it is meant to undo no longer exists.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
The function to call.
<callback>
<arg type="table" name="undo">See <page text="Undo Structure">Structures/Undo</page>.</arg>
<arg type="vararg" name="...">What was passed after the function callback argument.</arg>

<ret type="boolean" name="result" default="nil">Returning `false` will mark execution of this function as "failed", meaning that the undo might be skipped if no other entities are removed by it. This is useful when for example an entity you want to access is removed therefore there's nothing to do.</ret>
</callback>

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: Arguments to pass to the function (after the undo info table)

functions.name: Create
functions.description: Begins a new undo entry

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the undo message to show to players

functions.name: Do_Undo
functions.description:
Processes an undo block (in table form). This is used internally by the undo manager when a player presses Z.

You should use `gm_undo` or `gm_undonum *num*` console commands instead of calling this function directly.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: The undo block to process as an <page>Structures/Undo</page>

functions.name: Finish
functions.description: Completes an undo entry, and registers it with the player's client

arguments.name: NiceText
arguments.description: Text that appears in the player's undo history. If unset, is set to undo's name.

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description:
Serverside, returns a table containing all undo blocks of all players. Clientside, returns a table of the local player's undo blocks.
<note>Serverside, this table's keys use <page>Player:UniqueID</page> to store a player's undo blocks.</note>

functions.name: MakeUIDirty
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Makes the UI dirty - it will re-create the controls the next time it is viewed.

functions.name: ReplaceEntity
functions.description:
Replaces any instance of the "from" reference with the "to" reference, in any existing undo block.

You very likely want to call <page>cleanup.ReplaceEntity</page> with the same entities as well.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: The old entity

arguments.name: to
arguments.description: The new entity to replace the old one. Can also be a `NULL` to remove the entity from the undo system.

functions.name: SetCustomUndoText
functions.description: Sets a custom undo text for the current undo block

arguments.name: customText
arguments.description: The text to display when the undo block is undone

functions.name: SetPlayer
functions.description: Sets the player which the current undo block belongs to

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player responsible for undoing the block

functions.name: SetupUI
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Adds a hook (CPanelPaint) to the control panel paint function so we can determine when it is being drawn.

name: usermessage
description:
<deprecated>You should be using the <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

The usermessage library is used to receive user messages from the server on the client.

<warning>Usermessages have a limit of only 256 bytes!</warning>

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Returns a table of every usermessage hook

functions.name: Hook
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should be using <page>net</page> instead</deprecated>

Sets a hook for the specified to be called when a usermessage with the specified name arrives.

<warning>Usermessages have a limit of only 256 bytes!</warning>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The message name to hook to.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called if the specified message was received.

<callback>
<arg type="bf_read" name="msg">The object to read your custom data from.</arg>
<arg type="vararg" name="preArgs"></arg>
</callback>

arguments.name: preArgs
arguments.description: Arguments that are passed to the callback function when the hook is called.

functions.name: IncomingMessage
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Called by the engine when a usermessage arrives, this method calls the hook function specified by <page>usermessage.Hook</page> if any.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The message name.

arguments.name: msg
arguments.description: The message.

name: utf8
description:
The utf8 library provides basic support for UTF-8 encoding. This library does not provide any support for Unicode other than the handling of the encoding. Any operation that needs the meaning of a character, such as character classification, is outside its scope.

Unless stated otherwise, all functions that expect a byte position as a parameter assume that the given position is either the start of a byte sequence or one plus the length of the subject string. As in the string library, negative indices count from the end of the string.

functions.name: char
functions.description: Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

arguments.name: codepoints
arguments.description: Unicode code points to be converted in to a UTF-8 string.

returnValues.description: UTF-8 string generated from given arguments.

functions.name: charpattern
functions.description: This is NOT a function, it's a <page text="pattern">Patterns</page> (a string, not a function) which matches exactly one UTF-8 byte sequence, assuming that the subject is a valid UTF-8 string.

functions.name: codepoint
functions.description: Returns the codepoints (as numbers) from all characters in the given string that start between byte position startPos and endPos. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence. This functions similarly to <page>string.byte</page>.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the code(s) from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The starting byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The ending byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

functions.name: codes
functions.description: Returns an iterator (like <page>string.gmatch</page>) which returns both the position and codepoint of each utf8 character in the string. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the codes from.

returnValues.description: The iterator (to be used in a for loop).

functions.name: force
functions.description:
Forces a string to contain only valid UTF-8 data. Invalid sequences are replaced with U+FFFD (the Unicode replacement character).

This is a lazy way for users to ensure a string contains only valid UTF-8 data.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that will become a valid UTF-8 string.

functions.name: GetChar
functions.description: A UTF-8 compatible version of <page>string.GetChar</page>.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string that you will be searching with the supplied index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index's value of the string to be returned.

functions.name: len
functions.description: Returns the number of UTF-8 sequences in the given string between positions startPos and endPos (both inclusive). If it finds any invalid UTF-8 byte sequence, returns false as well as the position of the first invalid byte.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string to calculate the length of.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The starting position to get the length from.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The ending position to get the length from.

returnValues.description: The number of UTF-8 characters in the string. If there are invalid bytes, this will be false.
The position of the first invalid byte. If there were no invalid bytes, this will be nil.

functions.name: offset
functions.description: Returns the byte-index of the n'th UTF-8-character after the given startPos (nil if none). startPos defaults to 1 when n is positive and -1 when n is negative. If n is zero, this function instead returns the byte-index of the UTF-8-character startPos lies within.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the byte position from.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: The position to get the beginning byte position from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The offset for n.

returnValues.description: Starting byte-index of the given position.

functions.name: sub
functions.description:
A UTF-8 compatible version of <page>string.sub</page>.
<warning>Avoid using this function on large strings every tick/frame, as it may cause lags.</warning>

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string you'll take a sub-string out of.

arguments.name: StartPos
arguments.description: The position of the first character that will be included in the sub-string.

arguments.name: EndPos
arguments.description: The position of the last character to be included in the sub-string. It can be negative to count from the end.

name: util
description: `util.worldpicker` is for picking an entity in the world while [GUI](gui) is open.

functions.name: AddNetworkString
functions.description:
Adds the specified string to a string table, which will cache it and network it to all clients automatically.
Whenever you want to create a net message with net.Start, you must add the name of that message as a networked string via this function. If the passed string already exists, nothing will happen and the ID of the existing item will be returned. Each unique network name needs to be pooled once - do not put this function call into any other functions if you're using a constant string. Preferable place for this function is in a serverside lua file, or in a shared file with the net.Receive function. The string table used for this function does not interfere with the engine string tables and has 4095 slots. This limit is shared among all entities, SetNW* and SetGlobal* functions. If you exceed the limit, you cannot create new variables, and you will get the following warning: ```lua Warning: Table networkstring is full, can't add [key] ``` Existing variables will still get updated without the warning. You can check the limit by counting up until util.NetworkIDToString returns nil

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: Adds the specified string to the string table.

returnValues.description:
The id of the string that was added to the string table.
Same as calling util.NetworkStringToID.

functions.name: Compress
functions.description:
Compresses the given string using the [LZMA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LZMA) algorithm.

Use with <page>net.WriteData</page> and <page>net.ReadData</page> for networking and  <page>util.Decompress</page> to decompress the data.

<note>The output of this function will have the uncompressed size of the data prepended to it as an 8-byte little-endian integer. [Source](https://github.com/garrynewman/bootil/blob/beb4cec8ad29533965491b767b177dc549e62d23/src/Bootil/Utility/CompressionLZMA.cpp#L56-L63)

You may therefore experience issues using the output of this function **_outside of Garry's Mod_**. If you need to do this, you will need to manually strip the first 8 bytes from the compressed output, or use third-party tools such as [gmod-lzma](https://github.com/WilliamVenner/gmod-lzma-rs) to decompress the output instead.</note>

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: String to compress.

returnValues.description: The compressed string, or an empty string if the input string was zero length ("").

functions.name: CRC
functions.description:
Generates the [CRC Checksum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclic_redundancy_check) of the specified string.

<warning>
This is NOT a hashing function. It is a checksum, typically used for error detection/data corruption detection. It is possible for this function to generate "collisions", where two different strings will produce the same CRC. If you need a hashing function, use <page>util.SHA256</page>.
</warning>

arguments.name: stringToChecksum
arguments.description: The string to calculate the checksum of.

functions.name: Decompress
functions.description:
Decompresses the given string using [LZMA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LZMA) algorithm. Used to decompress strings previously compressed with <page>util.Compress</page>.

<note>This function expects the compressed input data to have the uncompressed size of the data prepended to it as an 8-byte little-endian integer. [Source](https://github.com/garrynewman/bootil/blob/beb4cec8ad29533965491b767b177dc549e62d23/src/Bootil/Utility/CompressionLZMA.cpp#L101)

If your compressed input data was compressed by <page>util.Compress</page>, you don't need to worry about this - the uncompressed size of the data is already prepended to its output.

However, if your compressed data was produced using standard tools **_outside of Garry's Mod_**, you will need to manually prepend the length of the uncompressed data to its compressed form as an 8-byte little endian integer, or use third-party tools such as [gmod-lzma](https://github.com/WilliamVenner/gmod-lzma-rs) to compress your data instead.</note>

arguments.name: compressedString
arguments.description: The compressed string to decompress.

arguments.name: maxSize
arguments.description: The maximum size of uncompressed data in bytes, if greater it fails.

returnValues.description: The original, decompressed string or `nil` on failure or invalid input. Also returns empty string if the input string was zero length ("").

functions.name: Effect
functions.description:
Creates an effect with the specified data.

For Orange Box `.pcf` particles, see <page>Global.ParticleEffect</page>, <page>Global.ParticleEffectAttach</page> and  <page>Global.CreateParticleSystem</page>.

<note>
When dispatching an effect from the server, some values may be clamped for networking optimizations. Visit the Set accessors on <page>CEffectData</page> to see which ones are affected.

You will need to couple this function with <page>Global.IsFirstTimePredicted</page> if you want to use it in a <page text="predicted hook">Prediction</page>.
</note>

arguments.name: effectName
arguments.description:
The name of the effect to create.

You can find a list of <page text="built-in engine effects here">Default_Effects</page>. You can create your own, [example effects can be found here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/effects) and [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/base/entities/effects).

arguments.name: effectData

arguments.name: allowOverride
arguments.description: Whether Lua-defined effects should override engine-defined effects with the same name for this/single function call.

arguments.name: ignorePredictionOrRecipientFilter
arguments.description:
Can either be a boolean to ignore the prediction filter or a <page>CRecipientFilter</page>.

Set this to true if you wish to call this function in multiplayer from server.

functions.name: FilterText

Filters given text using Steam's filtering system. The function will obey local client's Steam settings for chat filtering:

<note>In some cases, especially in a chatbox, messages from some players may return an empty string if the context argument used for filtering is `TEXT_FILTER_CHAT` and [if the local player has blocked the sender of the message on Steam](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-issues/issues/5161#issuecomment-1035153941).</note>

<upload src="70c/8d9e680b626348b.png" size="50426" name="image.png">
</upload>

returnValues.description: The filtered text based on given settings.

functions.name: GetModelInfo
functions.description:
Returns a table containing the info about the model.

<note>This function will silently fail if used on models with following strings in them:
* _shared
* _anims
* _gestures
* _anim
* _postures
* _gst
* _pst
* _shd
* _ss
* _anm
* _include</note>

arguments.name: mdl
arguments.description: Model path

returnValues.description:
The model info as a table with the following keys:
* <page>number</page> **SkinCount** - Identical to <page>Entity:SkinCount</page>.
* <page>string</page> **KeyValues** - Valve key-value formatted info about the model's physics (Constraint Info, etc). This is limited to 4096 characters.
* <page>string</page> **ModelKeyValues** - Valve key-value formatted info about the model ($keyvalues command in the .qc of the model), if present
* <page>number</page> **MeshCount** - Number of meshes the model has
* <page>number</page> **BoneCount** - Number of bones the model has
* <page>number</page> **Flags** - Model flags
* <page>boolean</page> **StaticProp** - Whether the model is meant to be a static prop (a specific flag)

functions.name: GetModelMeshes
functions.description:
Returns a table of visual meshes of given model.
<note>This does not work on brush models (`*number` models)</note>
See also <page>ENTITY:GetRenderMesh</page>.

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The full path to a model to get the visual meshes of.

arguments.name: lod
arguments.description: Which LOD to retrieve. 0 is the best quality, increasing the number lowers the model quaility.

arguments.name: bodygroupMask
arguments.description: Bodygroup combination for the model. This can be in format of `"000000"` where each number represents a bodygroup option.

returnValues.description:
A table of tables with the following format:
* <page>string</page> material - The material of the specific mesh
* <page>table</page> triangles - A table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>es ready to be fed into <page>IMesh:BuildFromTriangles</page>
* <page>table</page> verticies - A table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>es representing all the vertices of the mesh. This table is used internally to generate the "triangles" table.

Each <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page> returned also has an extra table of tables field called "weights" with the following data:
* <page>number</page> bone - The bone this vertex is attached to
* <page>number</page> weight - How "strong" this vertex is attached to the bone. A vertex can be attached to multiple bones at once.

A table of tables containing the model bind pose (where the keys are the bone ID) with the following contents:
* <page>number</page> parent - The ID of the parent bone.
* <page>VMatrix</page> matrix - The bone's bind transform in model (not bone) space.

<note>This function internally uses <page>util.SteamIDTo64</page>, it previously utilized <page>Player:UniqueID</page> which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). This function now only uses the old method as a fallback if the name isn't found.</note>

arguments.description: The direction of the cone.

arguments.name: coneSine
arguments.description: The <page test="sine">math.sin</page> of the cone's angle.

arguments.name: coneCosine
arguments.description: The <page test="cosine">math.cos</page> of the cone's angle.

returnValues.description: `true` if the sphere intersects the cone, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: IsSphereIntersectingSphere
functions.description: Performs a sphere-sphere intersection and returns whether there was an intersection or not.

arguments.name: sphere1Position
arguments.description: Any position of the first sphere.

arguments.name: sphere1Radius
arguments.description: The radius of the first sphere.

arguments.name: sphere2Position
arguments.description: Any position of the second sphere.

arguments.name: sphere2Radius
arguments.description: The radius of the second sphere.

returnValues.description: `true` if there is an intersection, `false` otherwise.

functions.name: IsValidModel
functions.description:
Checks if the specified model is valid.


A model is considered invalid in following cases:
* Starts with a space or **maps**
* Doesn't start with **models**
* Contains any of the following:
* `_gestures`
* `_animations`
* `_postures`
* `_gst`
* `_pst`
* `_shd`
* `_ss`
* `_anm`
* `.bsp`
* `cs_fix`
* If the model isn't precached on the server, AND if the model file doesn't exist on disk
* If precache failed
* Model is the error model

Running this function will also precache the model.

arguments.name: modelName
arguments.description: Name/Path of the model to check.

returnValues.description: Whether the model is valid or not. Returns false clientside if the model is not precached by the server.

functions.name: IsValidPhysicsObject
functions.description: Checks if given numbered physics object of given entity is valid or not. Most useful for ragdolls.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity

arguments.name: physobj
arguments.description: Number of the physics object to test

functions.name: IsValidProp
functions.description: Checks if the specified prop is valid.

arguments.name: modelName
arguments.description: Name/Path of the model to check.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the specified prop is valid; otherwise false.

functions.name: IsValidRagdoll
functions.description: Checks if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll.

arguments.name: ragdollName
arguments.description: Name/Path of the ragdoll model to check.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll; otherwise false.

functions.name: JSONToTable
functions.description:
Converts a JSON string to a Lua table.

See <page>util.TableToJSON</page> for the opposite function.

<bug issue="3561">This will attempt to cast the string keys `"inf"`, `"nan"`, `"true"`, and `"false"` to their respective Lua values. This completely ignores nulls in arrays.</bug>
<bug issue="2407">Colors will not have the color metatable.</bug>

arguments.name: json
arguments.description: The JSON string to convert.

arguments.name: ignoreLimits
arguments.description:
ignore the depth and breadth limits, **use at your own risk!**.
<warning>If this is false, there is a limit of 15,000 keys total.</warning>

arguments.name: ignoreConversions
arguments.description:
ignore string to number conversions for table keys.
<warning>
if this is false, keys are converted to numbers wherever possible. This means using <page>Player:SteamID64</page> as keys won't work.
</warning>

returnValues.description: The table containing converted information. Returns `nil` on failure.

functions.name: KeyValuesToTable
functions.description:
Converts a Valve KeyValue string (typically from <page>util.TableToKeyValues</page>) to a Lua table.

<note>Due to how <page>table</page>s work in Lua, keys will not repeat within a table. See <page>util.KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder</page> for alternative.</note>

arguments.name: keyValues
arguments.description: The KeyValue string to convert.

arguments.name: usesEscapeSequences
arguments.description: If set to true, will replace `\t`, `\n`, `\"` and `\\` in the input text with their escaped variants

arguments.name: preserveKeyCase
arguments.description: Whether we should preserve key case (may fail) or not (always lowercase)

functions.name: KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder
functions.description: Similar to <page>util.KeyValuesToTable</page> but it also preserves order of keys.

arguments.name: keyvals
arguments.description: The key value string

arguments.name: usesEscapeSequences
arguments.description: If set to true, will replace `\t`, `\n`, `\"` and `\\` in the input text with their escaped variants

arguments.name: preserveKeyCase
arguments.description: Whether we should preserve key case (may fail) or not (always lowercase)

functions.name: LocalToWorld
functions.description: Returns a vector in world coordinates based on an entity and local coordinates

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity lpos is local to

arguments.name: lpos
arguments.description: Coordinates local to the ent

arguments.name: bonenum
arguments.description: The bonenumber of the ent lpos is local to

functions.name: MD5
functions.description:
Generates the [MD5 hash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5) of the specified string.
<warning>MD5 is considered cryptographically broken and is known to be vulnerable to a variety of attacks including duplicate return values. If security or duplicate returns is a concern, use <page>util.SHA256</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: stringToHash
arguments.description: The string to calculate the MD5 hash of.

returnValues.description: The MD5 hash of the string in hexadecimal form.

functions.name: NetworkIDToString
functions.description: Returns the networked string associated with the given ID from the string table.

arguments.name: stringTableID
arguments.description: ID to get the associated string from.

returnValues.description: The networked string, or nil if it wasn't found.

functions.name: NetworkStringToID
functions.description: Returns the networked ID associated with the given string from the string table.

arguments.name: networkString
arguments.description: String to get the associated networked ID from.

returnValues.description: The networked ID of the string, or 0 if it hasn't been networked with <page>util.AddNetworkString</page>.

functions.name: NiceFloat
functions.description: Formats a float by stripping off extra `0's` and `.'s`.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The float to format.

functions.name: ParticleTracer
functions.description: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the tracer effect.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The start position of the tracer.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The end position of the tracer.

arguments.name: doWhiz
arguments.description: Play the hit miss(whiz) sound.

functions.name: ParticleTracerEx
functions.description: Creates a tracer effect with the given parameters.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the tracer effect.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The start position of the tracer.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The end position of the tracer.

arguments.name: doWhiz
arguments.description: Play the hit miss(whiz) sound.

arguments.name: entityIndex
arguments.description: Entity index of the emitting entity.

arguments.name: attachmentIndex
arguments.description: Attachment index to be used as origin.

functions.name: PixelVisible
functions.description: Returns the visibility of a sphere in the world.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The center of the visibility test.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the sphere to check for visibility.

arguments.name: PixVis
arguments.description:
The PixVis handle created with <page>util.GetPixelVisibleHandle</page>.
<warning>Don't use the same handle twice per tick or it will give unpredictable results.</warning>

returnValues.description: Visibility, ranges from `0-1`. `0` when none of the area is visible, `1` when all of it is visible.

functions.name: PointContents
functions.description:
Returns the contents of the position specified.
<note>This function will sample only the world environments. It can be used to check if <page>Entity:GetPos</page> is underwater for example unlike <page>Entity:WaterLevel</page> which works for players only.</note>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Position to get the contents sample from.

functions.name: PrecacheModel
functions.description:
Precaches a model for later use. Model is cached after being loaded once.
<warning>
Modelprecache is limited to 8192 unique models. When it reaches the limit the game will crash.
</warning>

arguments.name: modelName
arguments.description: The model to precache.

functions.name: PrecacheSound
functions.description:
Precaches a sound for later use. Sound is cached after being loaded once.
<note>Soundcache is limited to 16384 unique sounds on the server.</note>

<bug>Broken on purpose because hitting the limit above causes the server to shutdown</bug>
<bug>Ultimately does nothing on client, and only works with sound scripts, not direct paths.</bug>

arguments.name: soundName
arguments.description: The sound to precache.

functions.name: QuickTrace
functions.description:
Performs a trace with the given origin, direction, and filter.
<note>
This function will throw an error in the menu realm because it internally uses util.TraceLine which doesn't exist in the menu realm and thus error.
</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The origin of the trace.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The direction of the trace times the distance of the trace. This is added to the origin to determine the endpos.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: Entity which should be ignored by the trace. Can also be a table of entities or a function - see <page>Structures/Trace</page>.

functions.name: RelativePathToFull_Menu
functions.description:
Converts the relative path of a given file to the full path on disk.
You can use <page>util.FullPathToRelative_Menu</page> to convert the full path back to the relative path.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: The relative path of a file, for example: `addons/[Name].gma`

arguments.name: mountPath
arguments.description: The path to look for the files and directories in. See <page text="this list">File_Search_Paths</page> for a list of valid paths.

returnValues.name: fullpath
returnValues.description: The full path to the file.

functions.name: RelativePathToGMA_Menu
functions.description: Returns which Workshop addon the given file belongs to.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: The relative path to a file, such as `materials/myMaterial.vmt`.

returnValues.name: addonInfo
returnValues.description:
The info about owner addon. Will return nil if the file doesn't belong to an addon. Table Structure:
```lua
Author	=	[Addon Author]
File	=	[Steam folder]\workshop\content\4000\[Addon ID]/[GMA Name].gma
ID	=	[Addon ID]
Title	=	[Addon Title]
```

functions.name: RemovePData
functions.description:
Removes persistent data of an offline player using their SteamID.

See also <page>Player:RemovePData</page> for a more convenient version of this function for online players, <page>util.SetPData</page> and
<page>util.GetPData</page> for the other accompanying functions.

<note>This function internally uses <page>util.SteamIDTo64</page>, it previously utilized <page>Player:UniqueID</page> which can cause collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry). This function now tries to remove both old and new entries.</note>

arguments.name: steamID
arguments.description: SteamID of the player to remove data of, in the `STEAM_0:0:0` format. See <page>Player:SteamID</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Variable name to remove

functions.name: ScreenShake
functions.description:
Makes the screen shake.

<note>The screen shake effect is rendered by modifying the view origin on the client. If you override the view origin in <page>GM:CalcView</page> you may not be able to see the shake effect.</note>

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description:
The origin of the effect.

Used serverside only, to determine which clients the event should be networked to.

arguments.name: amplitude
arguments.description: The strength of the effect. How far away from its origin the camera will move while shaking.

arguments.name: frequency
arguments.description: How many times per second to change the direction of the camera wobble. 40 is generally enough; values higher are hardly distinguishable.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: The duration of the effect in seconds.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description:
The range from the origin within which views will be affected, in Hammer units.

This is used when networking the event to clients only.

arguments.name: airshake
arguments.description:
Whether players in the air should also be affected.

Used serverside only to determine which clients to send the event to.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: If set, will only network the screen shake event to players present in the filter.

functions.name: SetPData
functions.description:
Sets persistent data for offline player using their SteamID.

See also <page>Player:SetPData</page> for a more convenient version of this function for online players, <page>util.RemovePData</page> and
<page>util.GetPData</page> for the other accompanying functions.
<note>This function internally uses <page>util.SteamIDTo64</page>, it previously utilized <page>Player:UniqueID</page> which could have caused collisions (two or more players sharing the same PData entry).</note>

arguments.name: steamID
arguments.description: SteamID of the player, in the `STEAM_0:0:0` format. See <page>Player:SteamID</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Variable name to store the value in.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to store.

functions.name: SHA1
functions.description:
Generates the [SHA-1 hash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-1) of the specified string.
<warning>SHA-1 is considered cryptographically broken and is known to be vulnerable to a variety of attacks. If security is a concern, use <page>util.SHA256</page>.</warning>

arguments.name: stringToHash
arguments.description: The string to calculate the SHA-1 hash of.

returnValues.description: The SHA-1 hash of the string in hexadecimal form.

functions.name: SHA256
functions.description: Generates the [SHA-256 hash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2) of the specified string. This is unique and will never return the same hash for a different string unlike <page>util.CRC</page> or <page>util.MD5</page> which are both vulnerable to duplicate returns.

arguments.name: stringToHash
arguments.description: The string to calculate the SHA-256 hash of.

returnValues.description: The SHA-256 hash of the string in hexadecimal form.

functions.name: SharedRandom
functions.description:
Generates a random float value that should be the same on client and server.

<note>This function is best used in a <page text="predicted hook">prediction</page></note>

arguments.name: uniqueName
arguments.description: The seed for the random value

arguments.name: min
arguments.description: The minimum value of the random range

arguments.name: max
arguments.description: The maximum value of the random range

arguments.name: additionalSeed
arguments.description: The additional seed

functions.name: SpriteTrail
functions.description: Adds a trail to the specified entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Entity to attach trail to

arguments.name: attachmentID
arguments.description: Attachment ID of the entities model to attach trail to. If you are not sure, set this to 0

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Color of the trail, use <page>Global.Color</page>

arguments.name: additive
arguments.description: Should the trail be additive or not

arguments.name: startWidth
arguments.description: Start width of the trail

arguments.name: endWidth
arguments.description: End width of the trail

arguments.name: lifetime
arguments.description: How long it takes to transition from startWidth to endWidth

arguments.name: textureRes
arguments.description: The resolution of trails texture. A good value can be calculated using this formula: 1 / ( startWidth + endWidth ) * 0.5

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: Path to the texture to use as a trail.

functions.name: Stack
functions.description: Returns a new <page>Stack</page> object.

functions.name: SteamIDFrom64
functions.description:
Given a <page text="64bit SteamID">Player:SteamID64</page> will return a <page text="STEAM_0:0:0">Player:SteamID</page> style Steam ID.

<note>This operation induces data loss. Not all fields of a 64bit SteamID can be represented using the `STEAM_0:0:0` format.</note>

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The 64 bit Steam ID

returnValues.description: String <page text="STEAM_0:0:0">Player:SteamID</page> style Steam ID representation.

functions.name: SteamIDTo64
functions.description: Converts a <page text="STEAM_0:0:0">Player:SteamID</page> style SteamID to a <page text="64bit SteamID">Player:SteamID64</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The <page text="STEAM_0:0:0">Player:SteamID</page> format SteamID

returnValues.description: <page text="64bit SteamID">Player:SteamID64</page> or 0 (as a string) on fail

functions.name: StringToType
functions.description:
Converts a string to the specified type.

This can be useful when dealing with ConVars.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to convert

arguments.name: typename
arguments.description: The type to attempt to convert the string to. This can be `vector`, `angle`, `float`, `int`, `bool`, or `string` (case insensitive).

returnValues.description: The result of the conversion, or nil if a bad type is specified.

functions.name: TableToJSON
functions.description:
Converts a table to a JSON string.

See <page>util.JSONToTable</page> for the opposite function.

<warning>All keys are strings in the JSON format, so all keys of other types will be converted to strings!
This can lead to loss of data where a number key could be converted into an already existing string key! (for example in a table like this: `{["5"] = "ok", [5] = "BBB"}`)

All integers will be output as decimals (5 -> 5.0), since all numbers in Lua are internally floating point values.
</warning>

<bug issue="3561">This will produce invalid JSON if the provided table contains nan or inf values.</bug>

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: Table to convert.

arguments.name: prettyPrint
arguments.description: Format and indent the JSON.

returnValues.description: A JSON formatted string containing the serialized data

functions.name: TableToKeyValues
functions.description:
Converts the given table into a Valve key value string.

Use <page>util.KeyValuesToTable</page> to perform the opposite transformation.

You should consider using <page>util.TableToJSON</page> instead.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table to convert.

arguments.name: rootKey
arguments.description: The root key name for the output KV table.

functions.name: Timer
functions.description: Creates a timer object. The returned timer will be already started with given duration.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: How long you want the timer to be. `Elapsed()` will return true only after this much time has passed.

returnValues.description:
A timer object. It has the following methods:
* `Reset()` - Resets and stops the timer.
* `Start( duration = 0 )` - (Re)starts the timer with given duration
* `Started()` - Returns `true` if the timer has been started. It will continue to return true even after the duration has passed.
* `Elapsed()` - Returns `true` if the timer duration has elapsed since its creation or the call to `Start()`
* `GetElaspedTime()` - Returns amount of time since timer started.

functions.name: TimerCycle
functions.description: Returns the time since this function has been last called

returnValues.description: Time since this function has been last called in ms

functions.name: tobool
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Global.tobool</page> instead.</deprecated>

Converts string or a number to a bool, if possible. Alias of <page>Global.tobool</page>.

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: A string or a number to convert.

returnValues.description: False if the input is equal to the string or boolean "false", if the input is equal to the string or number "0", or if the input is nil. Returns true otherwise.

functions.name: TraceEntity
functions.description: Runs a trace using the entity's collisionmodel between two points. This does not take the entity's angles into account and will trace its unrotated collisionmodel.

arguments.name: tracedata
arguments.description: Trace data. See <page>Structures/Trace</page>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to use

functions.name: TraceEntityHull
functions.description: Identical to <page>util.TraceHull</page> but uses an entity's [Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minimum_bounding_box) for `mins`/`maxs` inputs. (These 2 keys will be ignored in the provided table)

arguments.name: tracedata
arguments.description: Trace data. See <page>Structures/Trace</page>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to use mins/maxs of for the hull trace.

functions.name: TraceHull
functions.description:
Performs an AABB hull (axis-aligned bounding box, aka not rotated) trace with the given trace data.

This trace type cannot hit hitboxes.

See <page>util.TraceLine</page> for a simple line ("ray") trace.

<note>This function may not always give desired results clientside due to certain physics mechanisms not existing on the client. Use it serverside for accurate results.</note>

arguments.name: TraceData
arguments.description: The trace data to use. See <page>Structures/HullTrace</page>

functions.name: TraceLine
functions.description:
Performs an infinitely thin, invisible ray trace (or "trace") in a line based on the input and returns a table that contains information about what, if anything, the trace line hit or intersected.

Traces intersect with the physics meshes of <page text="solid">enums/SOLID</page>, <page text="server-side">States</page>, <page text="entities">Entity</page> (including the <page text="game world">game.GetWorld</page>) but cannot detect client-side only entities unless <page text="hitclientonly">Structures/Trace#hitclientonly</page> is set to true.

See <page>ents.FindAlongRay</page> if you wish for the trace to not stop on first intersection.
See <page>util.TraceHull</page> for a "box" type trace.

Traces do not differentiate between the inside and the outside faces of physics meshes. Because of this, if a trace starts within a solid physics mesh it will hit the inside faces of the physics mesh and may return unexpected values as a result.


You can use `r_visualizetraces` set to `1` (requires `sv_cheats` set to `1`) to visualize traces in real time for debugging purposes.

arguments.name: traceConfig
arguments.description: A table of data that configures the trace. See <page>Structures/Trace</page> for available options.

returnValues.description:
A table of information detailing where and what the trace line intersected, or `nil` if the trace is being done before the <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> hook.

For the table's format and available options see the <page>Structures/TraceResult</page> page.

functions.name: TypeToString
functions.description: Converts a type to a (nice, but still parsable) string

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: What to convert

functions.name: worldpicker.Active
functions.description: Returns if the user is currently picking an entity.

functions.name: worldpicker.Finish
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Finishes the world picking. This is called when a user presses their mouse after calling <page>util.worldpicker.Start</page>.

arguments.name: tr
arguments.description: <page>Structures/TraceResult</page> from the mouse press

functions.name: worldpicker.Start
functions.description: Starts picking an entity in the world. This will suppress the next mouse click, and instead use it as a direction in the trace sent to the callback.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
Function to call after an entity choice has been made.

<callback>
<arg type="table" name="tr"><page text="TraceResult">Structures/TraceResult</page> from the mouse press. `tr.Entity` will return the entity clicked</arg>
</callback>

name: vgui
description:
The **vgui** library allows you to script and create your own panels using **V**alve's **G**raphical **U**ser **I**nterface (VGUI) system.

For an alphabetically ordered list of VGUI panels, see <page>VGUI Element List</page>.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
Creates a panel by the specified classname.
<note>Custom VGUI elements are not loaded instantly. Use <page>GM:OnGamemodeLoaded</page> to create them on startup.</note>

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description:
Classname of the panel to create.

Default panel classnames can be found on the <page>VGUI Element List</page>.

New panels can be registered via <page>vgui.Register</page>

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: Panel to parent to.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Custom name of the created panel for scripting/debugging purposes. Can be retrieved with <page>Panel:GetName</page>.

returnValues.description: The created panel, or `nil` if creation failed for whatever reason.

functions.name: CreateFromTable
functions.description: Creates a panel from a table, used alongside <page>vgui.RegisterFile</page> and <page>vgui.RegisterTable</page> to efficiently define, register, and instantiate custom panels.

arguments.name: metatable
arguments.description: Your PANEL table.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: Which panel to parent the newly created panel to.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Custom name of the created panel for scripting/debugging purposes. Can be retrieved with <page>Panel:GetName</page>.

returnValues.description: The created panel, or `nil` if creation failed for whatever reason.

functions.name: CreateX
functions.description: <internal></internal> Creates an engine panel.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: Class of the panel to create

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: If specified, parents created panel to given one

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the created panel

functions.name: CursorVisible
functions.description: Returns whenever the cursor is currently active and visible.

returnValues.description: Whether the cursor is visible or not.

functions.name: Exists
functions.description: Returns true if Lua-defined panel exists by name. Uses <page>vgui.GetControlTable</page> internally.

arguments.name: Panelname
arguments.description: The name of the panel to get test.

returnValues.description: Whether a panel with given name was registered yet or not.

functions.name: FocusedHasParent
functions.description: Returns whether the currently focused panel is a child of the given one.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The parent panel to check the currently focused one against. This doesn't need to be a direct parent (focused panel can be a child of a child and so on).

returnValues.description: Whether or not the focused panel is a child of the passed one.

functions.name: GetAll
functions.description:
Returns all Lua-created panels.

Used internally for <page>PANEL:PreAutoRefresh</page> and <page>PANEL:PostAutoRefresh</page>.

returnValues.description: List of all Lua created panels.

functions.name: GetControlTable
functions.description: Returns the table of a Lua-defined panel by name. Does not return parent members of the table!

arguments.name: Panelname
arguments.description: The name of the panel to get the table of.

returnValues.description: The `PANEL` table of the a Lua-defined panel with given name.

functions.name: GetHoveredPanel
functions.description:
Returns the panel the cursor is hovering above.

<warning>This returns a cached value that is only updated after rendering and `before` the next VGUI Think/Layout pass.

ie. it lags one frame behind panel layout and is completely unhelpful for <page>PANEL:Paint</page> if your panels are moving around under the mouse a lot every frame.</warning>

returnValues.description: The panel that the user is currently hovering over with their cursor.

functions.name: GetKeyboardFocus
functions.description: Returns the panel which is currently receiving keyboard input.

functions.name: GetWorldPanel
functions.description:
Returns the global world panel which is the parent to all others, except for the HUD panel.

See also <page>Global.GetHUDPanel</page>.

functions.name: IsHoveringWorld
functions.description: Returns whenever the cursor is hovering the world panel.

functions.name: Register
functions.description: Registers a panel for later creation via <page>vgui.Create</page>.

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description:
Classname of the panel to register. This is what you will need to pass to <page>vgui.Create</page>'s first argument.

This must be unique, including classnames of entities due to internal usage of <page>baseclass.Set</page>.

arguments.name: panelTable
arguments.description: The table containing the panel information.

arguments.name: baseName
arguments.description: Classname of a panel to inherit functionality from. Functions with same names will be overwritten preferring the panel that is being registered.

returnValues.description: The given panel table from second argument

functions.name: RegisterFile
functions.description:
Registers a new <page>VGUI</page> panel from a file, to be used with <page>vgui.CreateFromTable</page>.

File file must use the `PANEL` global that is provided just before the file is <page>Global.include</page>d, for example:


```
PANEL.Base = "Panel"

function PANEL:Init()
-- Your code...
end

function PANEL:Think()
-- Your code...
end
```

arguments.name: file

returnValues.description: A table containing info about the panel.

functions.name: RegisterTable
functions.description:
Registers a table to use as a panel, to be used with <page>vgui.CreateFromTable</page>.

All this function does is assigns Base key to your table and returns the table.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: The <page>PANEL</page> table.

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: A base for the panel.

name: video
description: The video library.

functions.name: Record
functions.description: Attempts to create an <page>IVideoWriter</page>.

arguments.name: config

The error string, if there is an error

name: weapons
description: The weapons library allows you to access information about any scripted weapons loaded into the game, as well as register your own weapons.

functions.name: Get
functions.description:
Get a `copy` of weapon table by name. This function also inherits fields from the weapon's base class, unlike <page>weapons.GetStored</page>.
<note> This will only work on SWEP's, this means that this will not return anything for HL2/HL:S weapons. </note>

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Class name of weapon to retrieve

functions.name: GetList
functions.description: Get a list of all the registered SWEPs. This does not include weapons added to spawnmenu manually.

returnValues.description: List of all the registered SWEPs

functions.name: GetStored
functions.description:
Gets the REAL weapon table, not a copy. The produced table does *not* inherit fields from the weapon's base class, unlike <page>weapons.Get</page>.

<warning>Modifying this table will modify what is stored by the weapons library. Take a copy or use <page>weapons.Get</page> to avoid this.</warning>

arguments.name: weapon_class
arguments.description: Weapon class to retrieve weapon table of

functions.name: IsBasedOn
functions.description: Checks if name is based on base

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Entity's class name to be checked

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Base class name to be checked

returnValues.description: Returns true if class name is based on base, else false.

functions.name: OnLoaded
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called after all SWEPS have been loaded and runs <page>baseclass.Set</page> on each one.

You can retrieve all the currently registered SWEPS with <page>weapons.GetList</page>.

<note>This is not called after a SWEP auto refresh, and thus the inherited baseclass functions retrieved with <page>baseclass.Get</page> will not be updated</note>

functions.name: Register
functions.description:
Registers a Scripted Weapon (SWEP) class manually. When the engine spawns an entity, weapons registered with this function will be created if the class names match.

See also <page>scripted_ents.Register</page> for Scripted Entities (SENTs)

<bug pull="1300">Sub-tables provided in the first argument will not carry over their metatable, and will receive a BaseClass key if the table was merged with the base's. Userdata references, which includes Vectors, Angles, Entities, etc. will not be copied.</bug>

arguments.name: ENT
arguments.description:
The SWEP table to register.
For the table's format and available options see the <page>Structures/SWEP</page> page.

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Classname to assign to that swep

name: widgets
description:
The widgets library.

Widgets allow the player to have mouse interaction with entities, such as being able to manipulate the [bones of an NPC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3gG0t39-pQ).

functions.name: PlayerTick
functions.description: <internal></internal> Automatically called to update all widgets.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player

arguments.name: mv
arguments.description: Player move data

functions.name: RenderMe
functions.description: Renders a widget. Normally you won't need to call this.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Widget entity to render
